english_text: Abu Bakr told us, he said: Waki' told us, from Isra'il, from Jabir, from 'Amir, regarding a man who is asked: "Have you divorced?" and he had not divorced, but says: "Yes." He said: "[It is] a lie."
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← وَكِيعٌ ← إِسْرَائِيلُ ← جَابِرٌ ← عَامِرٌ
narrators_en: Abu Bakr → Waki' → Israil → Jabir → Amir

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: نا هِشَامٌ، عَنِ ابْنِ شُبْرُمَةُ، عَنِ الشَّعْبِيِّ قَالَ: النِّيَّةُ فِيمَا خَفِيَ، فَأَمَّا فِيمَا ظَهَرَ فَلَا نِيَّةَ فِيهِ
english_text: Abu Bakr told us, he said: Hisham told us, from Ibn Shubrumah, from Al-Sha'bi, who said: "Intention applies to what is hidden, but as for what is apparent, there is no intention in it."
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← هِشَامٌ ← ابْنُ شُبْرُمَةَ ← الشَّعْبِيُّ
narrators_en: Abu Bakr → Hisham → Ibn Shubrumah → Al-Sha'bi

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: نا مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ عَتِيكٍ، عَنْ خَالِدِ بْنِ دِينَارٍ، عَنِ الْحَسَنِ، فِي رَجُلٍ طَلَّقَ امْرَأَتَهُ وَاحِدَةً يَنْوِي ثَلَاثًا قَالَ: هِيَ وَاحِدَةٌ
english_text: Abu Bakr told us, he said: Muhammad ibn 'Atik told us, from Khalid ibn Dinar, from Al-Hasan, regarding a man who divorced his wife once intending three. He said: "It is one."
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ عَتِيكٍ ← خَالِدُ بْنُ دِينَارٍ ← الْحَسَنُ
narrators_en: Abu Bakr → Muhammad b. 'Atik → Khalid b. Dinar → Al-Hasan

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: نا حُمَيْدُ بْنُ عَبْدِ الرَّحْمَنِ، عَنْ جَعْفَرٍ الْأَحْمَرِ، عَنْ مُطَرِّفٍ، عَنِ الْحَكَمِ قَالَ: هِيَ وَاحِدَةٌ
english_text: Abu Bakr told us, he said: Hamid ibn 'Abd al-Rahman told us, from Ja'far al-Ahmar, from Mutarrif, from Al-Hakam, who said: "It is one."
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← حُمَيْدُ بْنُ عَبْدِ الرَّحْمَنِ ← جَعْفَرٌ الْأَحْمَرُ ← مُطَرِّفٌ ← الْحَكَمُ
narrators_en: Abu Bakr → Hamid b. Abd al-Rahman → Ja'far al-Ahmar → Mutarrif → Al-Hakam

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: نا حَفْصٌ، عَنْ لَيْثٍ، عَنِ الْحَكَمِ قَالَ: هِيَ وَاحِدَةٌ
english_text: Abu Bakr told us, he said: Hafs told us, from Layth, from Al-Hakam, who said: "It is one."
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← حَفْصٌ ← لَيْثٌ ← الْحَكَمُ
narrators_en: Abu Bakr → Hafs → Layth → Al-Hakam

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: نا حَفْصٌ، عَنْ لَيْثٍ، عَنِ الْحَكَمِ، فِي رَجُلٍ قَالَ لِامْرَأَتِهِ: أَنْتِ طَالِقٌ، وَأَشَارَ بِيَدِهِ ثَلَاثًا، قَالَ: فَسَأَلُوهُ عَنْ ذَلِكَ؟ فَقَالَ: هِيَ وَاحِدَةٌ
english_text: Abu Bakr told us, he said: Hafs told us, from Layth, from Al-Hakam, regarding a man who said to his wife: "You are divorced," and gestured with his hand three times. He said: They asked him about that, and he said: "It is one."
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← حَفْصٌ ← لَيْثٌ ← الْحَكَمُ
narrators_en: Abu Bakr → Hafs → Layth → Al-Hakam

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: نا جَرِيرٌ، عَنْ بَيَانٍ، قَالَ: سُئِلَ الشَّعْبِيُّ عَنْ أَبْوَابِ الطَّلَاقِ، فَقَالَ الشَّعْبِيُّ: "سُئِلَ رَجُلٌ مَرَّةً: أَطَلَّقْتَ امْرَأَتَكَ؟ قَالَ: فَأَوْمَأَ بِيَدِهِ بِأَرْبَعِ أَصَابِعَ، وَلَمْ يَتَكَلَّمْ فَفَارَقَ امْرَأَتَهُ
english_text: Abu Bakr told us, he said: Jarir told us, from Bayan, who said: Al-Sha'bi was asked about the chapters of divorce. Al-Sha'bi said: "A man was once asked: 'Did you divorce your wife?' He said: So he gestured with his hand with four fingers and did not speak, so he separated from his wife."
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← جَرِيرٌ ← بَيَانٌ
narrators_en: Abu Bakr → Jarir → Bayan

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: نا ابْنُ مُبَارَكٍ، عَنْ مَعْمَرٍ، عَنْ قَتَادَةَ، عَنْ سَعِيدِ بْنِ الْمُسَيِّبِ قَالَ: اللِّعَانُ تَطْلِيقَةٌ بَائِنَةٌ
english_text: Abu Bakr told us, he said: Ibn Mubarak told us, from Ma'mar, from Qatadah, from Sa'id ibn al-Musayyib, who said: "Li'an is an irrevocable divorce."
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← ابْنُ مُبَارَكٍ ← مَعْمَرٌ ← قَتَادَةُ ← سَعِيدُ بْنُ الْمُسَيِّبِ
narrators_en: Abu Bakr → Ibn Mubarak → Ma'mar → Qatadah → Sa'id b. al-Musayyib

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: نا ابْنُ نُمَيْرٍ، عَنْ أَبِي حَنِيفَةَ، عَنْ إِبْرَاهِيمَ قَالَ: اللِّعَانُ تَطْلِيقَةٌ بَائِنَةٌ
english_text: Abu Bakr told us, he said: Ibn Numayr told us, from Abu Hanifah, from Ibrahim, who said: "Li'an is an irrevocable divorce."
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← ابْنُ نُمَيْرٍ ← أَبُو حَنِيفَةَ ← إِبْرَاهِيمُ
narrators_en: Abu Bakr → Ibn Numayr → Abu Hanifah → Ibrahim

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: نا هِشَامٌ، عَنْ مُغِيرَةَ، قَالَ: قُلْتُ لِإِبْرَاهِيمَ: الْمُلَاعِنُ أَشَدُّ مِنَ الَّذِي يُطَلِّقُ ثَلَاثًا؟ فَقَالَ: نَعَمْ
english_text: Abu Bakr told us, he said: Hisham told us, from Mughirah, who said: I said to Ibrahim: "Is the one who performs Li'an worse than the one who divorces three times?" He said: "Yes."
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← هِشَامٌ ← مُغِيرَةُ ← إِبْرَاهِيمُ
narrators_en: Abu Bakr → Hisham → Mughirah → Ibrahim

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: نا هُشَيْمٌ، عَنْ إِسْمَاعِيلَ، عَنِ الشَّعْبِيِّ قَالَ: الْمُلَاعَنَةُ أَشَدُّ مِنَ الرَّجْمِ
english_text: Abu Bakr told us, he said: Hushaym told us, from Isma'il, from Al-Sha'bi, who said: "Mutual cursing (Mula'anah) is more severe than stoning."
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← هُشَيْمٌ ← إِسْمَاعِيلُ ← الشَّعْبِيُّ
narrators_en: Abu Bakr → Hushaym → Isma'il → Al-Sha'bi

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: نا سُفْيَانُ بْنُ عُيَيْنَةَ، عَنِ الزُّهْرِيِّ، عَنْ عُبَيْدِ اللَّهِ، وَسُلَيْمَانَ بْنِ يَسَارٍ، وَحُمَيْدِ بْنِ عَبْدِ الرَّحْمَنِ: سَمِعْنَا أَبَا هُرَيْرَةَ يَقُولُ: سَأَلْتُ عُمَرَ عَنْ رَجُلٍ مِنْ أَهْلِ الْبَحْرَيْنِ طَلَّقَ امْرَأَتَهُ تَطْلِيقَةً أَوْ تَطْلِيقَتَيْنِ، فَتَزَوَّجَتْ، ثُمَّ إِنَّ زَوْجَهَا طَلَّقَهَا، ثُمَّ إِنَّ الْأَوَّلَ تَزَوَّجَهَا، عَلَى كَمْ هِيَ عِنْدَهُ؟ قَالَ: هِيَ عَلَى مَا بَقِيَ مِنَ الطَّلَاقِ
english_text: Abu Bakr told us, he said: Sufyan ibn 'Uyaynah told us, from Al-Zuhri, from 'Ubayd Allah, Sulayman ibn Yasar, and Humayd ibn 'Abd al-Rahman: We heard Abu Hurayrah saying: I asked 'Umar about a man from the people of Bahrain who divorced his wife once or twice, so she married [another], then her husband divorced her, then the first one married her [again]. On how many [divorces] is she with him? He said: "She is on what remains of the divorce."
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← سُفْيَانُ بْنُ عُيَيْنَةَ ← الزُّهْرِيُّ ← عُبَيْدُ اللَّهِ وَسُلَيْمَانُ بْنُ يَسَارٍ وَحُمَيْدُ بْنُ عَبْدِ الرَّحْمَنِ ← أَبُو هُرَيْرَةَ
narrators_en: Abu Bakr → Sufyan b. 'Uyaynah → Al-Zuhri → 'Ubayd Allah, Sulayman b. Yasar & Humayd b. 'Abd al-Rahman → Abu Hurayrah

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: نا حَفْصٌ، عَنْ أَشْعَثَ، وَحَجَّاجٍ، عَنِ الْحَكَمِ، عَنْ عَبْدِ الرَّحْمَنِ بْنِ أَبِي لَيْلَى، عَنْ أَبِي لَيْلَى قَالَ: تَرْجِعُ إِلَيْهِ بِمَا بَقِيَ مِنَ الطَّلَاقِ
english_text: Abu Bakr told us, he said: Hafs told us, from Ash'ath and Hajjaj, from Al-Hakam, from 'Abd al-Rahman ibn Abi Layla, from Abu Layla, who said: "She returns to him with what remains of the divorce."
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← حَفْصٌ ← أَشْعَثُ وَحَجَّاجٌ ← الْحَكَمُ ← عَبْدُ الرَّحْمَنِ بْنُ أَبِي لَيْلَى ← أَبُو لَيْلَى
narrators_en: Abu Bakr → Hafs → Ash'ath & Hajjaj → Al-Hakam → 'Abd al-Rahman b. Abi Layla → Abu Layla

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: نا ابْنُ عُلَيَّةَ، عَنْ دَاوُدَ، عَنِ الشَّعْبِيِّ، أَنَّ زِيَادًا، سَأَلَ عِمْرَانَ بْنَ حُصَيْنٍ، وَشُرَيْحًا، عَنِ الرَّجُلِ يُطَلِّقُ امْرَأَتَهُ تَطْلِيقَةً أَوْ تَطْلِيقَتَيْنِ فَتَبِينُ، فَيَتَزَوَّجُهَا رَجُلٌ، فَيُطَلِّقُهَا أَوْ يَمُوتُ عَنْهَا، فَيَتَزَوَّجُهَا الْأَوَّلُ، عَلَى كَمْ تَكُونُ عِنْدَهُ؟ فَقَالَ عِمْرَانُ: عَلَى مَا بَقِيَ مِنَ الطَّلَاقِ وَقَالَ شُرَيْحٌ: نِكَاحٌ جَدِيدٌ وَطَلَاقٌ جَدِيدٌ
english_text: Abu Bakr told us, he said: Ibn 'Ulayyah told us, from Dawud, from Al-Sha'bi, that Ziyad asked 'Imran ibn Husayn and Shurayh about a man who divorces his wife once or twice, and she becomes separated, then a man marries her and divorces her or dies leaving her, then the first one marries her. On how many [divorces] is she with him? 'Imran said: "On what remains of the divorce." And Shurayh said: "A new marriage and a new divorce."
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← ابْنُ عُلَيَّةَ ← دَاوُدُ ← الشَّعْبِيُّ ← زِيَادٌ
narrators_en: Abu Bakr → Ibn Ulayyah → Dawud → Al-Sha'bi → Ziyad

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: نا حَفْصُ بْنُ غِيَاثٍ، عَنْ حَجَّاجٍ، عَنْ عَمْرِو بْنِ شُعَيْبٍ، قَالَ: كَانَ عُمَرُ، وَأَبيِ، وَأَبُو الدَّرْدَاءِ، وَمُعَاذٌ يَقُولُونَ: تَرْجِعُ إِلَيْهِ عَلَى مَا بَقِيَ
english_text: Abu Bakr told us, he said: Hafs ibn Ghiyath told us, from Hajjaj, from 'Amr ibn Shu'ayb, who said: 'Umar, Ubayy, Abu al-Darda', and Mu'adh used to say: "She returns to him on what remains."
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← حَفْصُ بْنُ غِيَاثٍ ← حَجَّاجٌ ← عَمْرُو بْنُ شُعَيْبٍ
narrators_en: Abu Bakr → Hafs b. Ghiyath → Hajjaj → 'Amr b. Shu'ayb

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: نا وَكِيعٌ، وَعَلِيُّ بْنُ هَاشِمٍ، عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي لَيْلَى، عَنْ مَزِيدَةَ بْنِ جَابِرٍ، عَنْ أَبِيهِ، عَنْ عَلِيٍّ قَالَ: لَا يَهْدِمُ الزَّوَاجَ إِلَّا الثَّلَاثُ
english_text: Abu Bakr told us, he said: Waki' and 'Ali ibn Hashim told us, from Ibn Abi Layla, from Mazidah ibn Jabir, from his father, from 'Ali, who said: "Nothing demolishes the marriage except three [divorces]."
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← وَكِيعٌ وَعَلِيُّ بْنُ هَاشِمٍ ← ابْنُ أَبِي لَيْلَى ← مَزِيدَةُ بْنُ جَابِرٍ ← أَبُوهُ ← عَلِيٌّ
narrators_en: Abu Bakr → Waki' & Ali b. Hashim → Ibn Abi Layla → Mazidah b. Jabir → His Father → Ali

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: نا غُنْدَرٌ، عَنْ شُعْبَةَ، عَنِ الْحَكَمِ، عَنْ مَزِيدَةَ بْنِ جَابِرٍ، عَنْ أَبِيهِ، عَنْ عَلِيٍّ قَالَ: عَلَى مَا بَقِيَ
english_text: Abu Bakr told us, he said: Ghundar told us, from Shu'bah, from Al-Hakam, from Mazidah ibn Jabir, from his father, from 'Ali, who said: "On what remains."
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← غُنْدَرٌ ← شُعْبَةُ ← الْحَكَمُ ← مَزِيدَةُ بْنُ جَابِرٍ ← أَبُوهُ ← عَلِيٌّ
narrators_en: Abu Bakr → Ghundar → Shu'bah → Al-Hakam → Mazidah b. Jabir → His Father → 'Ali

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: نا أَبُو خَالِدٍ الْأَحْمَرُ، عَنْ حَجَّاجٍ، عَنْ عَمْرِو بْنِ شُعَيْبٍ، قَالَ: قَضَى عُمَرُ، وَمُعَاذٌ، وَزَيْدٌ، وَأُبَيٌّ، وَعَبْدُ اللَّهِ بْنُ عُمَرَ أَنَّهَا عَلَى مَا بَقِيَ مِنَ الطَّلَاقِ
english_text: Abu Bakr told us, he said: Abu Khalid al-Ahmar told us, from Hajjaj, from 'Amr ibn Shu'ayb, who said: 'Umar, Mu'adh, Zayd, Ubayy, and 'Abd Allah ibn 'Umar judged that she is on what remains of the divorce.
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← أَبُو خَالِدٍ الْأَحْمَرُ ← حَجَّاجٌ ← عَمْرُو بْنُ شُعَيْبٍ
narrators_en: Abu Bakr → Abu Khalid al-Ahmar → Hajjaj → 'Amr b. Shu'ayb

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: نا أَبُو خَالِدٍ الْأَحْمَرُ، عَنْ يَحْيَى بْنِ سَعِيدٍ، عَنْ سَعِيدٍ، عَنْ أَبِي هُرَيْرَةَ، عَنْ عُمَرَ قَالَ: عَلَى مَا بَقِيَ مِنَ الطَّلَاقِ
english_text: Abu Bakr told us, he said: Abu Khalid al-Ahmar told us, from Yahya ibn Sa'id, from Sa'id, from Abu Hurayrah, from 'Umar, who said: "On what remains of the divorce."
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← أَبُو خَالِدٍ الْأَحْمَرُ ← يَحْيَى بْنُ سَعِيدٍ ← سَعِيدٌ ← أَبُو هُرَيْرَةَ ← عُمَرُ
narrators_en: Abu Bakr → Abu Khalid al-Ahmar → Yahya b. Sa'id → Sa'id → Abu Hurayrah → 'Umar

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: نا وَكِيعٌ، نا إِسْمَاعِيلُ، عَنِ الشَّعْبِيِّ، عَنِ ابْنِ عُمَرَ قَالَ: هِيَ عِنْدَهُ عَلَى طَلَاقٍ مُسْتَقْبَلٍ
english_text: Abu Bakr told us, he said: Waki' told us, Isma'il told us, from Al-Sha'bi, from Ibn 'Umar, who said: "She is with him on a new divorce."
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← وَكِيعٌ ← إِسْمَاعِيلُ ← الشَّعْبِيُّ ← ابْنُ عُمَرَ
narrators_en: Abu Bakr → Waki' → Isma'il → Al-Sha'bi → Ibn 'Umar

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: نا وَكِيعٌ، عَنْ شُعْبَةَ، وَسُفْيَانُ، عَنْ حَمَّادٍ، عَنْ سَعِيدِ بْنِ جُبَيْرٍ، عَنِ ابْنِ عَبَّاسٍ، وَابْنِ عُمَرَ قَالَا: هِيَ عِنْدَهُ عَلَى طَلَاقٍ جَدِيدٍ
english_text: Abu Bakr told us, he said: Waki' told us, from Shu'bah and Sufyan, from Hammad, from Sa'id ibn Jubayr, from Ibn 'Abbas and Ibn 'Umar, who said: "She is with him on a new divorce."
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← وَكِيعٌ ← شُعْبَةُ وَسُفْيَانُ ← حَمَّادٌ ← سَعِيدُ بْنُ جُبَيْرٍ ← ابْنُ عَبَّاسٍ وَابْنُ عُمَرَ
narrators_en: Abu Bakr → Waki' → Shu'bah & Sufyan → Hammad → Sa'id b. Jubayr → Ibn Abbas & Ibn Umar

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: نا وَكِيعٌ، عَنْ شُعْبَةَ، عَنِ الْحَكَمِ، عَنْ إِبْرَاهِيمَ قَالَ: هِيَ عِنْدَهُ عَلَى ثَلَاثٍ
english_text: Abu Bakr told us, he said: Waki' told us, from Shu'bah, from Al-Hakam, from Ibrahim, who said: "She is with him on three [divorces]."
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← وَكِيعٌ ← شُعْبَةُ ← الْحَكَمُ ← إِبْرَاهِيمُ
narrators_en: Abu Bakr → Waki' → Shu'bah → Al-Hakam → Ibrahim

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: نا وَكِيعٌ، عَنِ الْأَعْمَشِ، عَنْ إِبْرَاهِيمَ قَالَ: "كَانَ أَصْحَابُ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ يَقُولُونَ: يَهْدِمُ الثَّلَاثَ، وَلَا يَهْدِمُ الْوَاحِدَةَ وَالثِّنْتَيْنِ، يَعْنِي طَلَاقًا وَاحِدًا
english_text: Abu Bakr told us, he said: Waki' told us, from Al-A'mash, from Ibrahim, who said: The companions of 'Abd Allah used to say: "It destroys the three, but it does not destroy the one and the two," meaning one divorce.
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← وَكِيعٌ ← الْأَعْمَشُ ← إِبْرَاهِيمُ
narrators_en: Abu Bakr → Waki' → Al-A'mash → Ibrahim

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: نا أَبُو مُعَاوِيَةَ، عَنِ الْأَعْمَشِ، عَنْ إِبْرَاهِيمَ قَالَ: "كَانَ أَصْحَابُ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ يَقُولُونَ: يَهْدِمُ الثَّلَاثَ، وَلَا يَهْدِمُ الْوَاحِدَةَ وَالثِّنْتَيْنِ
english_text: Abu Bakr told us, he said: Abu Mu'awiyah told us, from Al-A'mash, from Ibrahim, who said: "The companions of 'Abd Allah used to say: 'It destroys the three, but it does not destroy the one and the two.'"
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← أَبُو مُعَاوِيَةَ ← الْأَعْمَشُ ← إِبْرَاهِيمُ
narrators_en: Abu Bakr → Abu Mu'awiyah → Al-A'mash → Ibrahim

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: نا حَفْصٌ، عَنْ حَجَّاجٍ، عَنْ طَلْحَةَ، عَنْ إِبْرَاهِيمَ، "أَنَّ أَصْحَابَ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ كَانُوا يَقُولُونَ: يَهْدِمُ الْوَاحِدَةَ وَالثِّنْتَيْنِ كَمَا يَهْدِمُ الثَّلَاثَ إِلَّا عُبَيْدَةَ، فَإِنَّهُ قَالَ: هِيَ كَمَا بَقِيَ
english_text: Abu Bakr told us, he said: Hafs told us, from Hajjaj, from Talhah, from Ibrahim, that the companions of 'Abd Allah used to say: "It destroys the one and the two just as it destroys the three, except 'Ubaydah, for he said: 'She is on what remains.'"
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← حَفْصٌ ← حَجَّاجٌ ← طَلْحَةُ ← إِبْرَاهِيمُ
narrators_en: Abu Bakr → Hafs → Hajjaj → Talhah → Ibrahim

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: نا ابْنُ عُلَيَّةَ، عَنْ دَاوُدَ، عَنِ الشَّعْبِيِّ، عَنْ شُرَيْحٍ قَالَ: عَلَى طَلَاقٍ جَدِيدٍ، وَعَلَى نِكَاحٍ جَدِيدٍ
english_text: Abu Bakr told us, he said: Ibn 'Ulayyah told us, from Dawud, from Al-Sha'bi, from Shurayh, who said: "On a new divorce and on a new marriage."
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← ابْنُ عُلَيَّةَ ← دَاوُدُ ← الشَّعْبِيُّ ← شُرَيْحٌ
narrators_en: Abu Bakr → Ibn Ulayyah → Dawud → Al-Sha'bi → Shurayh

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: نا كَثِيرُ بْنُ هِشَامٍ، عَنْ جَعْفَرٍ، عَنْ مَيْمُونٍ قَالَ: هِيَ عِنْدَهُ عَلَى طَلَاقٍ جَدِيدٍ
english_text: Abu Bakr told us, he said: Kathir ibn Hisham told us, from Ja'far, from Maymun, who said: "She is with him on a new divorce."
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← كَثِيرُ بْنُ هِشَامٍ ← جَعْفَرٌ ← مَيْمُونٌ
narrators_en: Abu Bakr → Kathir b. Hisham → Ja'far → Maymun

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: نا يَزِيدُ بْنُ هَارُونَ، عَنِ ابْنِ عَوْنٍ، عَنْ رَجَاءٍ، عَنْ قَبِيصَةَ قُلْتُ: رَجُلٌ طَلَّقَ امْرَأَتَهُ تَطْلِيقَتَيْنِ فَبَانَتْ مِنْهُ، فَحَلَّتْ، فَتَزَوَّجَتْ زَوْجًا، فَدَخَلَ بِهَا، ثُمَّ مَاتَ عَنْهَا، أَوْ طَلَّقَهَا، فَرَجَعَتْ إِلَى الْأَوَّلِ عَلَى كَمْ هِيَ عِنْدَهُ؟ قَالَ: عَلَى مَا بَقِيَ مِنَ الطَّلَاقِ قَالَ: قُلْتُ: "فَطَلَّقَهَا أُخْرَى، فَبَانَتْ مِنْهُ، فَتَزَوَّجَتْ زَوْجًا فَدَخَلَ بِهَا، ثُمَّ مَاتَ عَنْهَا، أَوْ طَلَّقَهَا، فَرَجَعَتْ إِلَى زَوْجِهَا الْأَوَّلِ عَلَى كَمْ هِيَ عِنْدَهُ؟ قَالَ: هِيَ عَلَى مَا بَقِيَ قُلْتُ: فَطَلَّقَهَا أُخْرَى، فَحَلَّتْ فَتَزَوَّجَتْ زَوْجًا، ثُمَّ دَخَلَ بِهَا، ثُمَّ مَاتَ عَنْهَا، فَرَجَعَتْ إِلَى زَوْجِهَا الْأَوَّلِ، عَلَى كَمْ هِيَ عِنْدَهُ؟ قَالَ: هِيَ عَلَى ثَلَاثٍ
english_text: Abu Bakr told us, he said: Yazid ibn Harun told us, from Ibn 'Awn, from Raja', from Qabisah, who said: I said: "A man divorced his wife twice, and she became separated from him, then became lawful, so she married a husband who consummated the marriage with her, then he died or divorced her, so she returned to the first one. On how many is she with him?" He said: "On what remains of the divorce." He said: I said: "So he divorced her again, and she became separated from him, then she married a husband who consummated the marriage with her, then he died or divorced her, so she returned to her first husband. On how many is she with him?" He said: "She is on what remains." I said: "So he divorced her again, then she became lawful and married a husband, then he consummated the marriage with her, then he died, so she returned to her first husband. On how many is she with him?" He said: "She is on three."
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← يَزِيدُ بْنُ هَارُونَ ← ابْنُ عَوْنٍ ← رَجَاءٌ ← قَبِيصَةَ
narrators_en: Abu Bakr → Yazid b. Harun → Ibn 'Awn → Raja' → Qabisah

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: نا جَرِيرٌ، عَنْ مُغِيرَةَ، عَنْ إِبْرَاهِيمَ قَالَ: إِنْ دَخَلَ بِهَا فَإِنَّهَا عِنْدَهُ عَلَى ثَلَاثِ تَطْلِيقَاتٍ، وَإِنْ لَمْ يَدْخُلْ بِهَا فَإِنَّهَا عِنْدَهُ عَلَى بَقِيَّةِ الطَّلَاقِ
english_text: Abu Bakr told us, he said: Jarir told us, from Mughirah, from Ibrahim, who said: "If he has consummated the marriage with her, she is with him on three divorces. And if he has not consummated the marriage with her, she is with him on the remainder of the divorce."
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← جَرِيرٌ ← مُغِيرَةُ ← إِبْرَاهِيمُ
narrators_en: Abu Bakr → Jarir → Mughirah → Ibrahim

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: نا عَبْدُ الْأَعْلَى، عَنْ سَعِيدٍ، عَنْ قَتَادَةَ قَالَ: يَقَعُ عَلَيْهَا عِنْدَ كُلِّ طُهْرٍ مَرَّةً، ثُمَّ يُمْسِكُ حَتَّى تَطْهُرَ، فَإِذَا اسْتَبَانَ حَمْلُهَا بَانَتْ
english_text: Abu Bakr told us, he said: 'Abd al-A'la told us, from Sa'id, from Qatadah, who said: "It occurs upon her at every purification once, then he withholds until she becomes pure. If her pregnancy becomes evident, she is separated."
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← عَبْدُ الْأَعْلَى ← سَعِيدٌ ← قَتَادَةُ
narrators_en: Abu Bakr → 'Abd al-A'la → Sa'id → Qatadah

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: نا مُعَاذُ بْنُ مُعَاذٍ، عَنْ أَشْعَثَ، عَنِ الْحَسَنِ، أَنَّهُ قَالَ: فِي رَجُلٍ قَالَ لِامْرَأَتِهِ: إِذَا حَمَلْتِ فَأَنْتِ طَالِقٌ، قَالَ: يَغْشَاهَا فَإِذَا تَطَهَّرَتْ مِنَ الْحَيْضِ، ثُمَّ يُمْسِكُ عَنْهَا إِلَى مِثْلِ ذَلِكَ وَقَالَ ابْنُ سِيرِينَ: يَغْشَاهَا حَتَّى تَحْمِلَ
english_text: Abu Bakr told us, he said: Mu'adh ibn Mu'adh told us, from Ash'ath, from Al-Hasan, that he said regarding a man who said to his wife: "If you become pregnant, you are divorced." He said: "He has intercourse with her, then when she becomes pure from menstruation, he withholds from her until the like of that." And Ibn Sirin said: "He has intercourse with her until she becomes pregnant."
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← مُعَاذُ بْنُ مُعَاذٍ ← أَشْعَثُ ← الْحَسَنُ
narrators_en: Abu Bakr → Mu'adh b. Mu'adh → Ash'ath → Al-Hasan

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: نا عَبْدُ الْأَعْلَى، عَنْ سَعِيدٍ، عَنْ قَتَادَةَ، عَنِ الْحَسَنِ، وَعِكْرِمَةَ، وَكِتَابِ عُمَرَ بْنِ عَبْدِ الْعَزِيزِ أَنَّهُمْ قَالُوا: إِذَا سَبَقَ أَحَدُهُمَا صَاحِبَهُ بِالْإِسْلَامِ، فَلَا سَبِيلَ لَهُ عَلَيْهَا إِلَّا بِخِطْبَةٍ
english_text: Abu Bakr told us, he said: 'Abd al-A'la told us, from Sa'id, from Qatadah, from Al-Hasan, 'Ikrimah, and the letter of 'Umar ibn 'Abd al-'Aziz, that they said: "If one of them precedes the other in [accepting] Islam, he has no way to her except through a proposal."
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← عَبْدُ الْأَعْلَى ← سَعِيدٌ ← قَتَادَةُ ← الْحَسَنُ وَعِكْرِمَةُ
narrators_en: Abu Bakr → 'Abd al-A'la → Sa'id → Qatadah → Al-Hasan & 'Ikrimah

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: نا ابْنُ عُلَيَّةَ، عَنْ يُونُسَ، عَنِ الْحَسَنِ، فِي الْمَجُوسِيَّيْنِ، إِذَا أَسْلَمَا فَهُمَا عَلَى نِكَاحِهِمَا، وَإِنْ أَسْلَمَ أَحَدُهُمَا قَبْلَ صَاحِبِهِ انْقَطَعَ مَا بَيْنَهُمَا مِنَ النِّكَاحِ
english_text: Abu Bakr told us, he said: Ibn 'Ulayyah told us, from Yunus, from Al-Hasan, regarding two Magians: "If they both accept Islam, they remain in their marriage. And if one of them accepts Islam before the other, the marriage between them is severed."
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← ابْنُ عُلَيَّةَ ← يُونُسُ ← الْحَسَنُ
narrators_en: Abu Bakr → Ibn Ulayyah → Yunus → Al-Hasan

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: نا أَبُو بَكْرِ بْنُ عَيَّاشٍ، عَنْ هِشَامٍ، وَعَنِ الْحَسَنِ، مِثْلَهُ إِلَّا أَنَّهُ قَالَ: بَانَتْ مِنْهُ
english_text: Abu Bakr told us, he said: Abu Bakr ibn 'Ayyash told us, from Hisham, and from Al-Hasan, similar to it, except that he said: "She is separated from him."
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← أَبُو بَكْرِ بْنُ عَيَّاشٍ ← هِشَامٌ ← الْحَسَنُ
narrators_en: Abu Bakr → Abu Bakr b. 'Ayyash → Hisham → Al-Hasan

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: نا ابْنُ فُضَيْلٍ، عَنْ عَبْدِ الْمَلِكِ، عَنْ عَطَاءٍ، فِي الرَّجُلِ وَالْمَرْأَةِ يَكُونَانِ مُشْرِكَيْنِ فَيُسْلِمَانِ، قَالَ: يَثْبُتُ نِكَاحُهُمَا، فَإِنْ أَسْلَمَ أَحَدُهُمَا قَبْلَ الْآخَرِ انْقَطَعَ مَا بَيْنَهُمَا يَعْنِي بِذَلِكَ الْمَجُوسَ وَالْمُشْرِكِينَ غَيْرَ أَهْلِ الْكِتَابِ
english_text: Abu Bakr told us, he said: Ibn Fudayl told us, from 'Abd al-Malik, from 'Ata', regarding a man and a woman who are polytheists and accept Islam. He said: "Their marriage is confirmed. But if one of them accepts Islam before the other, what is between them is severed." He means by that the Magians and polytheists other than the People of the Book.
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← ابْنُ فُضَيْلٍ ← عَبْدُ الْمَلِكِ ← عَطَاءٌ
narrators_en: Abu Bakr → Ibn Fudayl → 'Abd al-Malik → 'Ata'

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: نا وَكِيعٌ، عَنْ سُفْيَانَ، عَنْ مَنْصُورٍ، عَنِ الْحَكَمِ، فِي الْمَجُوسِيَّيْنِ: إِذَا أَسْلَمَ أَحَدُهُمَا قَبْلَ صَاحِبِهِ فُرِّقَ بَيْنَهُمَا
english_text: Abū Bakr narrated to us, saying: Wakī‘ narrated to us, from Sufyān, from Manṣūr, from Al-Ḥakam, regarding two Majūs (Zoroastrians): “If one of them accepts Islam before the other, they are separated.”
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← وَكِيعٌ ← سُفْيَانَ ← مَنْصُورٍ ← الْحَكَمِ
narrators_en: Abū Bakr → Wakī‘ → Sufyān → Manṣūr → Al-Ḥakam

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: نا عَبْدُ الْأَعْلَى، عَنْ يُونُسَ، عَنِ الْحَسَنِ، عَنْ أَبِي الدَّرْدَاءِ قَالَ: ثَلَاثٌ لَا يُلْعَبُ بِهِنَّ النِّكَاحُ، وَالْعَتَاقُ، وَالطَّلَاقُ
english_text: Abū Bakr narrated to us, saying: ‘Abd al-A‘lā narrated to us, from Yūnus, from Al-Ḥasan, from Abū al-Dardā’, who said: “Three things are not to be played with: marriage, manumission, and divorce.”
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← عَبْدُ الْأَعْلَى ← يُونُسَ ← الْحَسَنِ ← أَبِي الدَّرْدَاءِ
narrators_en: Abū Bakr → ‘Abd al-A‘lā → Yūnus → Al-Ḥasan → Abū al-Dardā’

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: نا أَبُو مُعَاوِيَةَ، عَنْ حَجَّاجٍ، عَنْ سُلَيْمَانَ بْنِ سُحَيْمٍ، عَنْ سَعِيدِ بْنِ الْمُسَيِّبِ، عَنْ عُمَرَ قَالَ: أَرْبَعٌ جَائِزَةٌ فِي كُلِّ حَالٍ الْعِتْقُ، وَالطَّلَاقُ، وَالنِّكَاحُ، وَالنَّذْرُ
english_text: Abū Bakr narrated to us, saying: Abū Mu‘āwiyah narrated to us, from Ḥajjāj, from Sulaymān ibn Suḥaym, from Sa‘īd ibn al-Musayyib, from ‘Umar, who said: “Four things are binding in every situation: manumission, divorce, marriage, and vows.”
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← أَبُو مُعَاوِيَةَ ← حَجَّاجٍ ← سُلَيْمَانَ بْنِ سُحَيْمٍ ← سَعِيدِ بْنِ الْمُسَيِّبِ ← عُمَرَ
narrators_en: Abū Bakr → Abū Mu‘āwiyah → Ḥajjāj → Sulaymān ibn Suḥaym → Sa‘īd ibn al-Musayyib → ‘Umar

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: نا وَكِيعٌ، عَنْ أَبِي كِبْرَانَ، عَنِ الضَّحَّاكِ قَالَ: سَمِعْتُهُ يَقُولُ: ثَلَاثٌ لَا يُلْعَبُ بِهِنَّ الطَّلَاقُ، وَالنِّكَاحُ، وَالنَّذْرُ
english_text: Abū Bakr narrated to us, saying: Wakī‘ narrated to us, from Abū Kibrān, from Al-Ḍaḥḥāk, who said: I heard him say: “Three things are not to be played with: divorce, marriage, and vows.”
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← وَكِيعٌ ← أَبِي كِبْرَانَ ← الضَّحَّاكِ
narrators_en: Abū Bakr → Wakī‘ → Abū Kibrān → Al-Ḍaḥḥāk

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: نا إِسْمَاعِيلُ بْنُ عَيَّاشٍ، عَنْ عَمْرِو بْنِ مُهَاجِرٍ، قَالَ: كَتَبَ عَبْدُ الْمَلِكِ بْنُ مَرْوَانَ، وَسُلَيْمَانُ، وَعُمَرُ بْنُ عَبْدِ الْعَزِيزِ، وَيَزِيدُ بْنُ عَبْدِ الْمَلِكِ: مَهْمَا أَقَلْتُمُ السُّفَهَاءَ عَنْ شَيْءٍ فَلَا تُقِيلُوهُمُ الطَّلَاقَ، وَالْعَتَاقَ
english_text: Abū Bakr narrated to us, saying: Ismā‘īl ibn ‘Ayyāsh narrated to us, from ‘Amr ibn Muhājir, who said: ‘Abd al-Malik ibn Marwān, Sulaymān, ‘Umar ibn ‘Abd al-‘Azīz, and Yazīd ibn ‘Abd al-Malik wrote: “Whatever you pardon the foolish regarding anything, do not pardon them regarding divorce and manumission.”
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← إِسْمَاعِيلُ بْنُ عَيَّاشٍ ← عَمْرِو بْنِ مُهَاجِرٍ
narrators_en: Abū Bakr → Ismā‘īl ibn ‘Ayyāsh → ‘Amr ibn Muhājir

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: نا عِيسَى بْنُ يُونُسَ، عَنْ عَمْرٍو، عَنِ الْحَسَنِ، قَالَ: كَانَ الرَّجُلُ فِي الْجَاهِلِيَّةِ يُطَلِّقُ ثُمَّ يَرْجِعُ، يَقُولُ: كُنْتُ لَاعِبًا، وَيُعْتِقُ، ثُمَّ يَرْجِعُ يَقُولُ: كُنْتُ لَاعِبًا، فَأَنْزَلَ اللَّهُ " {وَلَا تَتَّخِذُوا آيَاتِ اللَّهِ هُزُوًا}، فَقَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ:" مَنْ طَلَّقَ، أَوْ حَرَّرَ، أَوْ أَنْكَحَ، أَوْ نَكَحَ فَقَالَ: إِنِّي كُنْتُ لَاعِبًا فَهُوَ جَائِزٌ
english_text: Abū Bakr narrated to us, saying: ‘Īsā ibn Yūnus narrated to us, from ‘Amr, from Al-Ḥasan, who said: In the time of ignorance, a man would divorce and then take it back, saying: “I was playing,” and would free a slave and then take it back, saying: “I was playing.” Then Allah revealed: {And do not take the verses of Allah in jest} [Al-Baqarah: 231]. The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: “Whoever divorces, frees, marries off, or marries, and then says: ‘I was playing,’ it is binding.”
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← عِيسَى بْنُ يُونُسَ ← عَمْرٍو ← الْحَسَنِ
narrators_en: Abū Bakr → ‘Īsā ibn Yūnus → ‘Amr → Al-Ḥasan

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: نا مَرْوَانُ بْنُ مُعَاوِيَةَ، عَنْ عَبْدِ الْعَزِيزِ بْنِ عُمَرَ بْنِ عَبْدِ الْعَزِيزِ، عَنْ سُلَيْمَانَ بْنِ حَبِيبٍ الْمُحَارِبِيِّ قَالَ: كَتَبَ إِلَيَّ عُمَرُ بْنُ عَبْدِ الْعَزِيزِ مَهْمَا أَقَلْتَ السُّفَهَاءَ عَنْ أَيْمَانِهِمْ، فَلَا تُقِيلَهُمُ الْعَتَاقَ وَالطَّلَاقَ
english_text: Abū Bakr narrated to us, saying: Marwān ibn Mu‘āwiyah narrated to us, from ‘Abd al-‘Azīz ibn ‘Umar ibn ‘Abd al-‘Azīz, from Sulaymān ibn Ḥabīb al-Muḥāribī, who said: ‘Umar ibn ‘Abd al-‘Azīz wrote to me: “Whatever you pardon the foolish regarding their oaths, do not pardon them regarding manumission and divorce.”
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← مَرْوَانُ بْنُ مُعَاوِيَةَ ← عَبْدِ الْعَزِيزِ بْنِ عُمَرَ بْنِ عَبْدِ الْعَزِيزِ ← سُلَيْمَانَ بْنِ حَبِيبٍ الْمُحَارِبِيِّ
narrators_en: Abū Bakr → Marwān ibn Mu‘āwiyah → ‘Abd al-‘Azīz ibn ‘Umar ibn ‘Abd al-‘Azīz → Sulaymān ibn Ḥabīb al-Muḥāribī

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: نا ابْنُ إِدْرِيسَ، عَنْ مُطَرِّفٍ، عَنِ الشَّعْبِيِّ، فِي رَجُلٍ يَقُولُ لِامْرَأَتِهِ: بهشتم، قَالَ: تَطْلِيقَةٌ
english_text: Abū Bakr narrated to us, saying: Ibn Idrīs narrated to us, from Muṭarrif, from Al-Sha‘bī, regarding a man who says to his wife: “Bahishtum” (Persian for “I have let go”). He said: “It is one divorce.”
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← ابْنُ إِدْرِيسَ ← مُطَرِّفٍ ← الشَّعْبِيِّ
narrators_en: Abū Bakr → Ibn Idrīs → Muṭarrif → Al-Sha‘bī

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: نا جَرِيرٌ، عَنْ مُغِيرَةَ، عَنْ إِبْرَاهِيمَ قَالَ: طَلَاقُ الْعَجَمِيِّ بِلِسَانِهِ جَائِزٌ
english_text: Abū Bakr narrated to us, saying: Jarīr narrated to us, from Mughīrah, from Ibrāhīm, who said: “The divorce of a non-Arab in his language is valid.”
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← جَرِيرٌ ← مُغِيرَةَ ← إِبْرَاهِيمَ
narrators_en: Abū Bakr → Jarīr → Mughīrah → Ibrāhīm

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: نا وَكِيعٌ، عَنْ أَبِي شِهَابٍ، عَنْ جَبَلَةَ بْنِ دَعْلَجٍ، عَنْ سَعِيدِ بْنِ جُبَيْرٍ قَالَ: "إِذَا طَلَّقَ الرَّجُلُ بِالْفَارِسِيَّةِ قَالَ: يَلْزَمُهَا
english_text: Abū Bakr narrated to us, saying: Wakī‘ narrated to us, from Abū Shihāb, from Jabalah ibn Da‘laj, from Sa‘īd ibn Jubayr, who said: “If a man divorces in Persian, he said: It is binding on her.”
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← وَكِيعٌ ← أَبِي شِهَابٍ ← جَبَلَةَ بْنِ دَعْلَجٍ ← سَعِيدِ بْنِ جُبَيْرٍ
narrators_en: Abū Bakr → Wakī‘ → Abū Shihāb → Jabalah ibn Da‘laj → Sa‘īd ibn Jubayr

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: نا وَكِيعٌ، عَنْ رَبِيعٍ، عَنِ الْحَسَنِ، فِي رَجُلٍ يَقُولُ لِامْرَأَتِهِ: بهشتم قَالَ: يَلْزَمُهُ الطَّلَاقُ
english_text: Abū Bakr narrated to us, saying: Wakī‘ narrated to us, from Rabī‘, from Al-Ḥasan, regarding a man who says to his wife: “Bahishtum.” He said: “Divorce is binding on him.”
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← وَكِيعٌ ← رَبِيعٍ ← الْحَسَنِ
narrators_en: Abū Bakr → Wakī‘ → Rabī‘ → Al-Ḥasan

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: نا وَكِيعٌ، عَنْ سُفْيَانَ، عَنْ أَبِي حُصَيْنٍ، عَنْ إِبْرَاهِيمَ، فِي الرَّجُلِ يَقُولُ لِامْرَأَتِهِ: بهشتم، بهشتم، بهشتم، قَالَ: قَدْ قَالَهَا بِلِسَانِهِ، ذَهَبَتْ مِنْهُ
english_text: Abū Bakr narrated to us, saying: Wakī‘ narrated to us, from Sufyān, from Abū Ḥuṣayn, from Ibrāhīm, regarding a man who says to his wife: “Bahishtum, Bahishtum, Bahishtum.” He said: “He has said it with his tongue; she is gone from him.”
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← وَكِيعٌ ← سُفْيَانَ ← أَبِي حُصَيْنٍ ← إِبْرَاهِيمَ
narrators_en: Abū Bakr → Wakī‘ → Sufyān → Abū Ḥuṣayn → Ibrāhīm

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: نا مُعْتَمِرُ بْنُ سُلَيْمَانَ، عَنْ أَبِيهِ، عَنْ أَبِي قِلَابَةَ، وَابْنِ سِيرِينَ قَالَا: "لَا يَحِلُّ الْخُلْعُ حَتَّى يُوجَدَ رَجُلٌ عَلَى بَطْنِهَا، لِأَنَّ اللَّهَ يَقُولُ: {إِلَّا أَنْ يَأْتِينَ بِفَاحِشَةٍ مُبَيِّنَةٍ}
english_text: Abū Bakr narrated to us, saying: Mu‘tamir ibn Sulaymān narrated to us, from his father, from Abū Qilābah and Ibn Sīrīn, who both said: “Khul‘ (divorce at the instance of the wife) is not lawful unless a man is found on her belly, because Allah says: {unless they commit a clear immorality} [Al-Nisa: 19].”
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← مُعْتَمِرُ بْنُ سُلَيْمَانَ ← أَبِيهِ ← أَبِي قِلَابَةَ وَابْنِ سِيرِينَ
narrators_en: Abū Bakr → Mu‘tamir ibn Sulaymān → His father → Abū Qilābah and Ibn Sīrīn

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: نا جَرِيرٌ، عَنْ مُغِيرَةَ، عَنْ أَبِيهِ، قَالَ: لَا يَحِلُّ لَهُ أَنْ يَأْخُذَ فِدْيَةً مِنِ امْرَأَتِهِ أَنْ لَا تُطِيعَهُ، وَلَا تَبَرَّ لَهُ قَسَمًا، فَإِنْ فَعَلَتْ ذَلِكَ فَكَانَ مِنْ قِبَلِهَا شَيْءٌ حَلَّتْ لَهُ الْفِدْيَةُ، فَإِنْ أَبَى أَنْ يَقْبَلَ مِنْهَا الْفِدْيَةَ، وَأَبَتْ أَنْ تُطِيعَهُ بَعَثَا حَكَمَيْنِ حَكَمًا مِنْ أَهْلِهِ، وَحَكَمًا مِنْ أَهْلِهَا
english_text: Abū Bakr narrated to us, saying: Jarīr narrated to us, from Mughīrah, from his father, who said: “It is not lawful for him to take a ransom from his wife unless she disobeys him or does not fulfill an oath for him. If she does that and something comes from her side, the ransom is lawful for him. If he refuses to accept the ransom from her and she refuses to obey him, they send two arbiters, one from his family and one from her family.”
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← جَرِيرٌ ← مُغِيرَةَ ← أَبِيهِ
narrators_en: Abū Bakr → Jarīr → Mughīrah → His father

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: نا وَكِيعٌ، عَنْ إِسْمَاعِيلَ، عَنِ الشَّعْبِيِّ قَالَ: إِذَا كَرِهَتِ الْمَرْأَةُ زَوْجَهَا فَلْيَأْخُذْ مِنْهَا وَلْيَدَعْهَا
english_text: Abū Bakr narrated to us, saying: Wakī‘ narrated to us, from Ismā‘īl, from Al-Sha‘bī, who said: “If a woman hates her husband, let him take (ransom) from her and leave her.”
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← وَكِيعٌ ← إِسْمَاعِيلَ ← الشَّعْبِيِّ
narrators_en: Abū Bakr → Wakī‘ → Ismā‘īl → Al-Sha‘bī

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: نا حَمَّادُ بْنُ سَلَمَةَ، عَنْ مَرْوَانَ الْأَصْفَرِ، عَنْ حُمَيْدِ بْنِ عَبْدِ الرَّحْمَنِ الْحِمْيَرِيِّ، قَالَ: "يَطِيبُ لَكَ الْخُلْعُ إِذَا قَالَتْ: لَا أَغْتَسِلُ لَكَ مِنَ الْجَنَابَةِ، وَلَا أَبَرُّ لَكَ قَسَمًا، وَلَا أُطِيعُ لَكَ أَمْرًا
english_text: Abū Bakr narrated to us, saying: Ḥammād ibn Salamah narrated to us, from Marwān al-Aṣfar, from Ḥumayd ibn ‘Abd al-Raḥmān al-Ḥimyarī, who said: “Khul‘ becomes lawful for you if she says: ‘I will not wash myself from Janaabah for you, I will not fulfill an oath for you, and I will not obey a command for you.’”
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← حَمَّادُ بْنُ سَلَمَةَ ← مَرْوَانَ الْأَصْفَرِ ← حُمَيْدِ بْنِ عَبْدِ الرَّحْمَنِ الْحِمْيَرِيِّ
narrators_en: Abū Bakr → Ḥammād ibn Salamah → Marwān al-Aṣfar → Ḥumayd ibn ‘Abd al-Raḥmān al-Ḥimyarī

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: نا وَكِيعٌ، عَنْ إِسْرَائِيلَ، عَنْ جَابِرٍ، عَنْ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ يَحْيَى، عَنْ عَلِيٍّ، قَالَ: "يَطِيبُ لِلرَّجُلِ الْخُلْعُ إِذَا قَالَتْ: لَا أَغْتَسِلُ مِنَ الْجَنَابَةِ، وَلَا أُطِيعُ لَكَ أَمْرًا، وَلَا أَبَرُّ لَكَ قَسَمًا، وَلَا أَكْرُمُ نَفْسًا
english_text: Abū Bakr narrated to us, saying: Wakī‘ narrated to us, from Isrā’īl, from Jābir, from ‘Abd Allāh ibn Yaḥyā, from ‘Alī, who said: “Khul‘ becomes lawful for a man if she says: ‘I will not wash myself from Janaabah, I will not obey a command for you, I will not fulfill an oath for you, and I will not honor myself.’”
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← وَكِيعٌ ← إِسْرَائِيلَ ← جَابِرٍ ← عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ يَحْيَى ← عَلِيٍّ
narrators_en: Abū Bakr → Wakī‘ → Isrā’īl → Jābir → ‘Abd Allāh ibn Yaḥyā → ‘Alī

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: نا وَكِيعٌ، عَنْ سُفْيَانَ، عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ بَذِيمَةَ، عَنْ مِقْسَمٍ قَالَ: إِذَا عَصَتْكَ أَوْ آذَتْكَ
english_text: Abū Bakr narrated to us, saying: Wakī‘ narrated to us, from Sufyān, from ‘Alī ibn Badhīmah, from Miqsam, who said: “If she disobeys you or harms you.”
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← وَكِيعٌ ← سُفْيَانَ ← عَلِيِّ بْنِ بَذِيمَةَ ← مِقْسَمٍ
narrators_en: Abū Bakr → Wakī‘ → Sufyān → ‘Alī ibn Badhīmah → Miqsam

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: نا وَكِيعٌ، عَنِ الْحَسَنِ، فِي قَوْلِهِ: {لَا جُنَاحَ}، قَالَ: "ذَلِكَ فِي الْخُلْعِ إِذَا قَالَتْ: لَا أَغْتَسِلُ لَكَ مِنَ الْجَنَابَةِ
english_text: Abū Bakr narrated to us, saying: Wakī‘ narrated to us, from Al-Ḥasan, regarding His saying: {there is no blame} [Al-Baqarah: 229], he said: “That is in Khul‘ if she says: ‘I will not wash myself from Janaabah for you.’”
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← وَكِيعٌ ← الْحَسَنِ
narrators_en: Abū Bakr → Wakī‘ → Al-Ḥasan

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: نا ابْنُ فُضَيْلٍ، عَنْ مُطَرِّفٍ، عَنْ خَالِدٍ السِّجِسْتَانِيِّ، عَنِ الضَّحَّاكِ، فِي قَوْلِهِ تَعَالَى: {لِتَذْهَبُوا بِبَعْضِ مَا آتَيْتُمُوهُنَّ إِلَّا أَنْ يَأْتِينَ بِفَاحِشَةٍ مُبَيِّنَةٍ} قَالَ: إِذَا فَعَلَتْ ذَلِكَ حَلَّ لَهُ أَنْ يَأْخُذَ مِنْهَا
english_text: Abū Bakr narrated to us, saying: Ibn Fuḍayl narrated to us, from Muṭarrif, from Khālid al-Sijistānī, from Al-Ḍaḥḥāk, regarding His saying: {that you may take [back] part of what you have given them unless they commit a clear immorality} [Al-Nisa: 19]. He said: “If she does that, it is lawful for him to take from her.”
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← ابْنُ فُضَيْلٍ ← مُطَرِّفٍ ← خَالِدٍ السِّجِسْتَانِيِّ ← الضَّحَّاكِ
narrators_en: Abū Bakr → Ibn Fuḍayl → Muṭarrif → Khālid al-Sijistānī → Al-Ḍaḥḥāk

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: نا ابْنُ أَبِي عُتْبَةَ، عَنْ عَبْدِ الْمَلِكِ، عَنْ عَطَاءٍ، فِي الرَّجُلِ يَخْلَعُ الْمَرْأَةَ قَالَ: إِذَا أَتَى ذَلِكَ مِنْ قِبَلِهَا فَلَا بَأْسَ
english_text: Abū Bakr narrated to us, saying: Ibn Abī ‘Utbah narrated to us, from ‘Abd al-Malik, from ‘Aṭā’, regarding a man who performs Khul‘ with a woman. He said: “If that comes from her side, there is no harm.”
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← ابْنُ أَبِي عُتْبَةَ ← عَبْدِ الْمَلِكِ ← عَطَاءٍ
narrators_en: Abū Bakr → Ibn Abī ‘Utbah → ‘Abd al-Malik → ‘Aṭā’

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: نا ابْنُ عُلَيَّةَ، عَنِ ابْنِ جُرَيْجٍ، عَنْ عَمْرِو بْنِ دِينَارٍ قَالَ: قَالَ جَابِرُ بْنُ زَيْدٍ: إِذَا كَانَ النُّشُوزُ مِنْ قِبَلِهَا حَلَّ لَهُ فِدَاؤُهَا
english_text: Abū Bakr narrated to us, saying: Ibn ‘Ulayyah narrated to us, from Ibn Jurayj, from ‘Amr ibn Dīnār, who said: Jābir ibn Zayd said: “If the disobedience is from her side, her ransom is lawful for him.”
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← ابْنُ عُلَيَّةَ ← ابْنِ جُرَيْجٍ ← عَمْرِو بْنِ دِينَارٍ ← جَابِرُ بْنُ زَيْدٍ
narrators_en: Abū Bakr → Ibn ‘Ulayyah → Ibn Jurayj → ‘Amr ibn Dīnār → Jābir ibn Zayd

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: نا ابْنُ عُلَيَّةَ، عَنِ ابْنِ جُرَيْجٍ، عَنْ هِشَامِ بْنِ عُرْوَةَ، كَانَ يَقُولُ: "لَا يَحِلُّ لَهُ الْفِدَاءُ، حَتَّى يَكُونَ الْفَسَادُ مِنْ قِبَلِهَا، وَلَمْ يَكُنْ يَقُولُ: لَا تَحِلُّ لَهُ حَتَّى تَقُولَ: لَا أَبَرُّ لَكَ قَسَمًا، وَلَا أَغْتَسِلُ مِنْ جَنَابَةٍ
english_text: Abū Bakr narrated to us, saying: Ibn ‘Ulayyah narrated to us, from Ibn Jurayj, from Hishām ibn ‘Urwah, who used to say: “Ransom is not lawful for him until the corruption is from her side.” He did not say: “It is not lawful for him until she says: ‘I will not fulfill an oath for you, and I will not wash myself from Janaabah.’”
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← ابْنُ عُلَيَّةَ ← ابْنِ جُرَيْجٍ ← هِشَامِ بْنِ عُرْوَةَ
narrators_en: Abū Bakr → Ibn ‘Ulayyah → Ibn Jurayj → Hishām ibn ‘Urwah

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: حَدَّثَنَا ابْنُ عُلَيَّةَ، عَنِ ابْنِ جُرَيْجٍ، قَالَ: كَانَ طَاوُسٌ يَقُولُ: "يَحِلُّ لَهُ الْفِدَاءُ، بِمَا قَالَ اللَّهُ: {إِلَّا أَنْ يَخَافَا أَلَّا يُقِيمَا حُدُودَ اللَّهِ}، وَلَمْ يَكُنْ يَقُولُ قَوْلَ السُّفَهَاءِ حَتَّى تَقُولَ: لَا أَغْتَسِلُ لَكَ مِنْ جَنَابَةٍ، وَلَكِنَّهُ كَانَ يَقُولُ: {إِلَّا أَنْ يَخَافَا أَلَّا يُقِيمَا حُدُودَ اللَّهِ} فِيمَا افْتَرَضَ لِكُلِّ وَاحِدٍ مِنْهُمَا، عَلَى صَاحِبِهِ فِي الْعِشْرَةِ وَالصُّحْبَةِ
english_text: Abū Bakr narrated to us, saying: Ibn ‘Ulayyah narrated to us, from Ibn Jurayj, who said: Ṭāwūs used to say: “Ransom is lawful for him based on what Allah said: {unless they fear that they will not keep [within] the limits of Allah} [Al-Baqarah: 229]. He did not say the foolish statement ‘until she says: I will not wash myself from Janaabah for you.’ But he used to say: {unless they fear that they will not keep [within] the limits of Allah} regarding what is obligatory for each of them towards the other in companionship and association.”
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← ابْنُ عُلَيَّةَ ← ابْنِ جُرَيْجٍ ← طَاوُسٌ
narrators_en: Abū Bakr → Ibn ‘Ulayyah → Ibn Jurayj → Ṭāwūs

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: نا غُنْدَرٌ، عَنْ شُعْبَةَ قَالَ: سَأَلْتُ الْحَكَمَ، عَنْ قَوْلِ الْمَرْأَةِ لِزَوْجِهَا: لَا أَغْتَسِلُ لَكَ مِنْ جَنَابَةٍ، وَلَا أَبَرُّ لَكَ قَسَمًا، وَلَا أُطِيعُ لَكَ أَمْرًا قَالَ: لَيْسَ بِشَيْءٍ، يُمْسِكُهَا
english_text: Abū Bakr narrated to us, saying: Ghundar narrated to us, from Shu‘bah, who said: I asked Al-Ḥakam about a woman saying to her husband: “I will not wash myself from Janaabah for you, I will not fulfill an oath for you, and I will not obey a command for you.” He said: “It is nothing; he keeps her.”
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← غُنْدَرٌ ← شُعْبَةَ ← الْحَكَمَ
narrators_en: Abū Bakr → Ghundar → Shu‘bah → Al-Ḥakam

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: نا ابْنُ عُلَيَّةَ، عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ إِسْحَاقَ، قَالَ: سُئِلَ الْقَاسِمُ بْنُ مُحَمَّدٍ: {إِلَّا أَنْ يَخَافَا أَلَّا يُقِيمَا حُدُودَ اللَّهِ} قَالَ: مَا افْتُرِضَ عَلَيْهِمَا فِي الْعِشْرَةِ وَالصُّحْبَةِ
english_text: Abū Bakr narrated to us, saying: Ibn ‘Ulayyah narrated to us, from Muḥammad ibn Isḥāq, who said: Al-Qāsim ibn Muḥammad was asked about {unless they fear that they will not keep [within] the limits of Allah}. He said: “What is obligatory upon them in companionship and association.”
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← ابْنُ عُلَيَّةَ ← مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ إِسْحَاقَ ← الْقَاسِمُ بْنُ مُحَمَّدٍ
narrators_en: Abū Bakr → Ibn ‘Ulayyah → Muḥammad ibn Isḥāq → Al-Qāsim ibn Muḥammad

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: نا ابْنُ عُلَيَّةَ، عَنْ أَيُّوبَ، عَنْ كَثِيرٍ، مَوْلَى ابْنِ سَمُرَةَ، أَنَّ عُمَرَ، أُتِيَ بِامْرَأَةٍ نَاشِزٍ، فَقَالَ لِزَوْجِهَا: اخْلَعْهَا
english_text: Abū Bakr narrated to us, saying: Ibn ‘Ulayyah narrated to us, from Ayyūb, from Kathīr, the freed slave of Ibn Samurah, that ‘Umar was brought a disobedient woman, so he said to her husband: “Perform Khul‘ with her.”
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← ابْنُ عُلَيَّةَ ← أَيُّوبَ ← كَثِيرٍ مَوْلَى ابْنِ سَمُرَةَ ← عُمَرَ
narrators_en: Abū Bakr → Ibn ‘Ulayyah → Ayyūb → Kathīr, freed slave of Ibn Samurah → ‘Umar

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: نا عِيسَى بْنُ يُونُسَ، عَنِ الْأَوْزَاعِيِّ، عَنِ الزُّهْرِيِّ، وَعَطَاءٍ، وَعَمْرِو بْنِ شُعَيْبٍ قَالُوا: لَا يَحِلُّ الْخُلْعُ إِلَّا مِنْ نَاشِزٍ
english_text: Abū Bakr narrated to us, saying: ‘Īsā ibn Yūnus narrated to us, from Al-Awzā‘ī, from Al-Zuhrī, ‘Aṭā’, and ‘Amr ibn Shu‘ayb, who said: “Khul‘ is not lawful except from a disobedient wife.”
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← عِيسَى بْنُ يُونُسَ ← الْأَوْزَاعِيِّ ← الزُّهْرِيِّ وَعَطَاءٍ وَعَمْرِو بْنِ شُعَيْبٍ
narrators_en: Abū Bakr → ‘Īsā ibn Yūnus → Al-Awzā‘ī → Al-Zuhrī, ‘Aṭā’ and ‘Amr ibn Shu‘ayb

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: نا وَكِيعٌ، عَنْ هِشَامِ بْنِ عُرْوَةَ، عَنْ أَبِيهِ، عَنْ جُمْهَانَ، أَنَّ امْرَأَةً اخْتَلَعَتْ مِنْ زَوْجِهَا بِخُلْعِهَا فَجَعَلَهُ عُثْمَانُ تَطْلِيقَةً وَمَا سَمَّى
english_text: Abū Bakr narrated to us, saying: Wakī‘ narrated to us, from Hishām ibn ‘Urwah, from his father, from Jumhān, that a woman performed Khul‘ from her husband. ‘Uthmān considered it one divorce, and he did not specify (how many).
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← وَكِيعٌ ← هِشَامِ بْنِ عُرْوَةَ ← أَبِيهِ ← جُمْهَانَ
narrators_en: Abū Bakr → Wakī‘ → Hishām ibn ‘Urwah → His father → Jumhān

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: نا أَبُو مُعَاوِيَةَ، عَنْ هِشَامِ بْنِ عُرْوَةَ، عَنْ أَبِيهِ قَالَ: خَلَعَ جُمْهَانُ الْأَسْلَمِيُّ امْرَأَةً، ثُمَّ نَدِمَ، وَنَدِمَتْ، فَأَتَوْا عُثْمَانَ، فَذَكَرُوا ذَلِكَ لَهُ، قَالَ: فَقَالَ عُثْمَانُ: هِيَ تَطْلِيقَةٌ إِلَّا أَنْ تَكُونَ سَمَّتْ شَيْئًا فَهُوَ مَا سَمَّتْ
english_text: Abū Bakr narrated to us, saying: Abū Mu‘āwiyah narrated to us, from Hishām ibn ‘Urwah, from his father, who said: Jumhān al-Aslamī performed Khul‘ with a woman, then he regretted it, and she regretted it. They came to ‘Uthmān and mentioned it to him. He said: ‘Uthmān said: “It is one divorce unless she specified something, then it is what she specified.”
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← أَبُو مُعَاوِيَةَ ← هِشَامِ بْنِ عُرْوَةَ ← أَبِيهِ
narrators_en: Abū Bakr → Abū Mu‘āwiyah → Hishām ibn ‘Urwah → His father

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: نا حَفْصٌ، عَنْ هِشَامٍ، عَنْ أَبِيهِ، عَنْ جُمْهَانَ، عَنْ عُثْمَانَ قَالَ: الْخُلْعُ تَطْلِيقَةٌ بَائِنَةٌ
english_text: Abū Bakr narrated to us, saying: Ḥafṣ narrated to us, from Hishām, from his father, from Jumhān, from ‘Uthmān, who said: “Khul‘ is one irrevocable divorce.”
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← حَفْصٌ ← هِشَامٍ ← أَبِيهِ ← جُمْهَانَ ← عُثْمَانَ
narrators_en: Abū Bakr → Ḥafṣ → Hishām → His father → Jumhān → ‘Uthmān

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: نا أَبُو مُعَاوِيَةَ، عَنْ عُثْمَانَ قَالَ: كَانَ أَبِي يَجْعَلُ الْخُلْعُ تَطْلِيقَةً بَائِنَةً
english_text: Abū Bakr narrated to us, saying: Abū Mu‘āwiyah narrated to us, from ‘Uthmān, who said: “My father used to consider Khul‘ as one irrevocable divorce.”
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← أَبُو مُعَاوِيَةَ ← عُثْمَانَ
narrators_en: Abū Bakr → Abū Mu‘āwiyah → ‘Uthmān

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: نا وَكِيعٌ، عَنْ إِبْرَاهِيمَ بْنِ زَيْدٍ، عَنْ دَاوُدَ بْنِ أَبِي عَاصِمٍ، عَنْ سَعِيدِ بْنِ الْمُسَيِّبِ، أَنَّ النَّبِيَّ صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ جَعَلَ الْخُلْعَ تَطْلِيقَةً
english_text: Abū Bakr narrated to us, saying: Wakī‘ narrated to us, from Ibrāhīm ibn Zayd, from Dāwūd ibn Abī ‘Āṣim, from Sa‘īd ibn al-Musayyib, that the Prophet ﷺ made Khul‘ one divorce.
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← وَكِيعٌ ← إِبْرَاهِيمَ بْنِ زَيْدٍ ← دَاوُدَ بْنِ أَبِي عَاصِمٍ ← سَعِيدِ بْنِ الْمُسَيِّبِ
narrators_en: Abū Bakr → Wakī‘ → Ibrāhīm ibn Zayd → Dāwūd ibn Abī ‘Āṣim → Sa‘īd ibn al-Musayyib

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: نا وَكِيعٌ، عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ مُبَارَكٍ، عَنْ يَحْيَى بْنِ أَبِي سَلَمَةَ قَالَ: الْخُلْعُ تَطْلِيقَةٌ بَائِنَةٌ
english_text: Abū Bakr narrated to us, saying: Wakī‘ narrated to us, from ‘Alī ibn al-Mubārak, from Yaḥyā ibn Abī Salamah, who said: “Khul‘ is one irrevocable divorce.”
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← وَكِيعٌ ← عَلِيِّ بْنِ مُبَارَكٍ ← يَحْيَى بْنِ أَبِي سَلَمَةَ
narrators_en: Abū Bakr → Wakī‘ → ‘Alī ibn al-Mubārak → Yaḥyā ibn Abī Salamah

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: نا وَكِيعٌ، وَابْنُ عُيَيْنَةَ، وَعَلِيُّ بْنُ هَاشِمٍ، عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي لَيْلَى، عَنْ طَلْحَةَ، عَنْ إِبْرَاهِيمَ، عَنْ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ قَالَ: لَا تَكُونُ تَطْلِيقَةً بَائِنَةً إِلَّا فِي فِدْيَةٍ، أَوْ إِيلَاءٍ إِلَّا أَنَّ عَلِيَّ بْنَ هَاشِمٍ قَالَ: عَنْ عَلْقَمَةَ، عَنْ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ
english_text: Abū Bakr narrated to us, saying: Wakī‘, Ibn ‘Uyaynah, and ‘Alī ibn Hāshim narrated to us, from Ibn Abī Laylā, from Ṭalḥah, from Ibrāhīm, from ‘Abd Allāh, who said: “There is no irrevocable divorce except in ransom or Īlā’ (oath of abstention).” Except that ‘Alī ibn Hāshim said: From ‘Alqamah, from ‘Abd Allāh.
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← وَكِيعٌ وَابْنُ عُيَيْنَةَ وَعَلِيُّ بْنُ هَاشِمٍ ← ابْنِ أَبِي لَيْلَى ← طَلْحَةَ ← إِبْرَاهِيمَ ← عَبْدِ اللَّهِ
narrators_en: Abū Bakr → Wakī‘ and Ibn ‘Uyaynah and ‘Alī ibn Hāshim → Ibn Abī Laylā → Ṭalḥah → Ibrāhīm → ‘Abd Allāh

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: نا شَرِيكٌ، عَنْ مُغِيرَةَ، عَنْ إِبْرَاهِيمَ، وَجَابِرٌ، عَنْ عَامِرٍ، وَعَطَاءٍ، عَنْ سَعِيدِ بْنِ جُبَيْرٍ قَالَا: الْخُلْعُ تَطْلِيقَةٌ بَائِنَةٌ
english_text: Abū Bakr narrated to us, saying: Sharīk narrated to us, from Mughīrah, from Ibrāhīm; and Jābir from ‘Āmir; and ‘Aṭā’ from Sa‘īd ibn Jubayr, who both said: “Khul‘ is one irrevocable divorce.”
narrators_ar:
أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← شَرِيكٌ ← مُغِيرَةَ ← إِبْرَاهِيمَ
أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← شَرِيكٌ ← جَابِرٌ ← عَامِرٍ
أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← شَرِيكٌ ← عَطَاءٍ ← سَعِيدِ بْنِ جُبَيْرٍ
narrators_en:
Abū Bakr → Sharīk → Mughīrah → Ibrāhīm
Abū Bakr → Sharīk → Jābir → ‘Āmir
Abū Bakr → Sharīk → ‘Aṭā’ → Sa‘īd ibn Jubayr

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: نا أَبُو الْأَحْوَصِ، عَنْ مُغِيرَةَ، عَنْ إِبْرَاهِيمَ قَالَ: الْخُلْعُ تَطْلِيقَةٌ بَائِنَةٌ وَالْإِيلَاءُ، وَالْمُبَارَأَةُ كَذَلِكَ
english_text: Abū Bakr narrated to us, saying: Abū al-Aḥwaṣ narrated to us, from Mughīrah, from Ibrāhīm, who said: “Khul‘ is one irrevocable divorce, and Īlā’ and Mubāra’ah are likewise.”
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← أَبُو الْأَحْوَصِ ← مُغِيرَةَ ← إِبْرَاهِيمَ
narrators_en: Abū Bakr → Abū al-Aḥwaṣ → Mughīrah → Ibrāhīm

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: نا أَبُو الْأَحْوَصِ، عَنْ مُغِيرَةَ، عَنْ عَبَّادٍ، عَنْ سَعِيدٍ، عَنْ قَتَادَةَ، عَنِ الْحَسَنِ، وَسَعِيدِ بْنِ الْمُسَيِّبِ، وَيُونُسَ، عَنِ الْحَسَنِ، فِي الرَّجُلِ يَخْلَعُ امْرَأَتَهُ قَالَا: أَخْذُهُ الْمَالَ تَطْلِيقَةٌ بَائِنَةٌ
english_text: Abū Bakr narrated to us, saying: Abū al-Aḥwaṣ narrated to us, from Mughīrah, from ‘Abbād, from Sa‘īd, from Qatādah, from Al-Ḥasan and Sa‘īd ibn al-Musayyib; and Yūnus from Al-Ḥasan, regarding a man who performs Khul‘ with his wife. They said: “His taking the money is one irrevocable divorce.”
narrators_ar:
أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← أَبُو الْأَحْوَصِ ← مُغِيرَةَ ← عَبَّادٍ ← سَعِيدٍ ← قَتَادَةَ ← الْحَسَنِ وَسَعِيدِ بْنِ الْمُسَيِّبِ
أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← أَبُو الْأَحْوَصِ ← يُونُسَ ← الْحَسَنِ
narrators_en:
Abū Bakr → Abū al-Aḥwaṣ → Mughīrah → ‘Abbād → Sa‘īd → Qatādah → Al-Ḥasan and Sa‘īd ibn al-Musayyib
Abū Bakr → Abū al-Aḥwaṣ → Yūnus → Al-Ḥasan

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: نا ابْنُ إِدْرِيسَ، عَنْ مُوسَى بْنِ مُسْلِمٍ، عَنْ مُجَاهِدٍ قَالَ: قَالَ عَلِيٌّ: إِذَا خَلَعَ الرَّجُلُ أَمْرَ امْرَأَتِهِ مِنْ عُنُقِهِ فَهِيَ وَاحِدَةٌ، وَإِنِ اخْتَارَتْهُ
english_text: Abū Bakr narrated to us, saying: Ibn Idrīs narrated to us, from Mūsā ibn Muslim, from Mujāhid, who said: ‘Alī said: “If a man removes the affair of his wife from his neck (performs Khul‘), it is one (divorce), even if she chooses him.”
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← ابْنُ إِدْرِيسَ ← مُوسَى بْنِ مُسْلِمٍ ← مُجَاهِدٍ
narrators_en: Abū Bakr → Ibn Idrīs → Mūsā ibn Muslim → Mujāhid

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: نا الْحَسَنُ بْنُ مُوسَى، عَنْ شَيْبَانَ، عَنْ يَحْيَى قَالَ: قَالَ قَبِيصَةُ بْنُ ذُؤَيْبٍ: الْخُلْعُ تَطْلِيقَةٌ، إِنْ شَاءَتْ تَزَوَّجَتْهُ بِصَدَاقٍ جَدِيدٍ
english_text: Abū Bakr narrated to us, saying: Al-Ḥasan ibn Mūsā narrated to us, from Shaybān, from Yaḥyā, who said: Qabīṣah ibn Dhu’ayb said: “Khul‘ is one divorce; if she wishes, she can marry him with a new dowry.”
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← الْحَسَنُ بْنُ مُوسَى ← شَيْبَانَ ← يَحْيَى
narrators_en: Abū Bakr → Al-Ḥasan ibn Mūsā → Shaybān → Yaḥyā

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: نا ابْنُ إِدْرِيسَ، عَنْ مُطَرِّفٍ، عَنِ الشَّعْبِيِّ قَالَ: كُلُّ خُلْعٍ أُخِذَ عَلَيْهِ فِدَاءٌ فَهُوَ طَلَاقٌ، وَهُوَ تَطْلِيقَةٌ بَائِنَةٌ
english_text: Abū Bakr narrated to us, saying: Ibn Idrīs narrated to us, from Muṭarrif, from Al-Sha‘bī, who said: “Every Khul‘ for which a ransom is taken is divorce, and it is one irrevocable divorce.”
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← ابْنُ إِدْرِيسَ ← مُطَرِّفٍ ← الشَّعْبِيِّ
narrators_en: Abū Bakr → Ibn Idrīs → Muṭarrif → Al-Sha‘bī

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو خَالِدٍ، عَنْ أَشْعَثَ، عَنِ الشَّعْبِيِّ، عَنْ شُرَيْحٍ قَالَ: كُلُّ خُلْعٍ تَطْلِيقَةٌ بَائِنَةٌ
english_text: Abū Khālid narrated to us, from Ash‘ath, from Al-Sha‘bī, from Shurayḥ, who said: “Every Khul‘ is one irrevocable divorce.”
narrators_ar: أَبُو خَالِدٍ ← أَشْعَثَ ← الشَّعْبِيِّ ← شُرَيْحٍ
narrators_en: Abū Khālid → Ash‘ath → Al-Sha‘bī → Shurayḥ

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: نا يَحْيَى بْنُ سَعِيدٍ، عَنِ ابْنِ جُرَيْجٍ، عَنْ عَطَاءٍ قَالَ: الْخُلْعُ تَطْلِيقَةٌ بَائِنَةٌ
english_text: Abū Bakr narrated to us, saying: Yaḥyā ibn Sa‘īd narrated to us, from Ibn Jurayj, from ‘Aṭā’, who said: “Khul‘ is one irrevocable divorce.”
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← يَحْيَى بْنُ سَعِيدٍ ← ابْنِ جُرَيْجٍ ← عَطَاءٍ
narrators_en: Abū Bakr → Yaḥyā ibn Sa‘īd → Ibn Jurayj → ‘Aṭā’

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: نا عَبْدُ الْأَعْلَى، عَنْ مَعْمَرٍ، عَنِ الزُّهْرِيِّ قَالَ: هُوَ تَطْلِيقَةٌ بَائِنَةٌ
english_text: Abū Bakr narrated to us, saying: ‘Abd al-A‘lā narrated to us, from Ma‘mar, from Al-Zuhrī, who said: “It is one irrevocable divorce.”
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← عَبْدُ الْأَعْلَى ← مَعْمَرٍ ← الزُّهْرِيِّ
narrators_en: Abū Bakr → ‘Abd al-A‘lā → Ma‘mar → Al-Zuhrī

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: نا عُمَرُ بْنُ هَارُونَ، عَنْ عَمْرِو بْنِ مَيْمُونٍ قَالَ: فِي قِرَاءَةِ أُبَيٍّ، الْخُلْعُ تَطْلِيقَةٌ بَائِنَةٌ
english_text: Abū Bakr narrated to us, saying: ‘Umar ibn Hārūn narrated to us, from ‘Amr ibn Maymūn, who said: In the reading of Ubayy: “Khul‘ is one irrevocable divorce.”
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← عُمَرُ بْنُ هَارُونَ ← عَمْرِو بْنِ مَيْمُونٍ
narrators_en: Abū Bakr → ‘Umar ibn Hārūn → ‘Amr ibn Maymūn

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: نا الثَّقَفِيُّ، عَنْ بُرْدٍ، عَنْ مَكْحُولٍ قَالَ: كُلُّ مُفْتَدِيَةٍ أَحَقُّ بِنَفْسِهَا، لَا تَرْجِعُ إِلَى زَوْجِهَا إِلَّا أَنْ تَشَاءَ
english_text: Abū Bakr narrated to us, saying: Al-Thaqafī narrated to us, from Burd, from Makḥūl, who said: “Every woman who redeems herself has more right to herself; she does not return to her husband unless she wishes.”
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← الثَّقَفِيُّ ← بُرْدٍ ← مَكْحُولٍ
narrators_en: Abū Bakr → Al-Thaqafī → Burd → Makḥūl

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: نا مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَزِيدَ، عَنْ سَعِيدِ بْنِ عَبْدِ الْعَزِيزِ، عَنْ مَكْحُولٍ قَالَ: الْخُلْعُ تَطْلِيقَةٌ
english_text: Abū Bakr narrated to us, saying: Muḥammad ibn Yazīd narrated to us, from Sa‘īd ibn ‘Abd al-‘Azīz, from Makḥūl, who said: “Khul‘ is one divorce.”
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَزِيدَ ← سَعِيدِ بْنِ عَبْدِ الْعَزِيزِ ← مَكْحُولٍ
narrators_en: Abū Bakr → Muḥammad ibn Yazīd → Sa‘īd ibn ‘Abd al-‘Azīz → Makḥūl

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا حَفْصٌ، عَنْ يَحْيَى بْنِ سَعِيدٍ، أَنَّ عُثْمَانَ بْنَ عَفَّانَ، جَعَلَ الْخُلْعَ تَطْلِيقَةً بَائِنَةً
english_text: Ḥafṣ narrated to us, from Yaḥyā ibn Sa‘īd, that ‘Uthmān ibn ‘Affān made Khul‘ one irrevocable divorce.
narrators_ar: حَفْصٌ ← يَحْيَى بْنِ سَعِيدٍ
narrators_en: Ḥafṣ → Yaḥyā ibn Sa‘īd

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: نا عَبْدُ الْأَعْلَى، عَنْ مَعْمَرٍ، عَنْ يَحْيَى، عَنْ أَبِي سَلَمَةَ، أَنَّهُ كَانَ يَقُولُ: الْخُلْعُ تَطْلِيقَةٌ بَائِنَةٌ
english_text: Abū Bakr narrated to us, saying: ‘Abd al-A‘lā narrated to us, from Ma‘mar, from Yaḥyā, from Abū Salamah, that he used to say: “Khul‘ is one irrevocable divorce.”
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← عَبْدُ الْأَعْلَى ← مَعْمَرٍ ← يَحْيَى ← أَبِي سَلَمَةَ
narrators_en: Abū Bakr → ‘Abd al-A‘lā → Ma‘mar → Yaḥyā → Abū Salamah

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: نا عَبْدُ الْأَعْلَى، عَنْ يُونُسَ، عَنِ الْحَسَنِ قَالَ: الْخُلْعُ تَطْلِيقَةٌ بَائِنَةٌ، وَمَا اشْتَرَطَتْ عَلَيْهِ مِنَ الطَّلَاقِ فَهُوَ لَهَا
english_text: Abū Bakr narrated to us, saying: ‘Abd al-A‘lā narrated to us, from Yūnus, from Al-Ḥasan, who said: “Khul‘ is one irrevocable divorce, and whatever divorce she stipulated against him is hers.”
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← عَبْدُ الْأَعْلَى ← يُونُسَ ← الْحَسَنِ
narrators_en: Abū Bakr → ‘Abd al-A‘lā → Yūnus → Al-Ḥasan

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: نا ابْنُ عُيَيْنَةَ، عَنْ عَمْرٍو، عَنْ طَاوُسٍ، عَنِ ابْنِ عَبَّاسٍ قَالَ: "إِنَّمَا هُوَ فُرْقَةٌ وَفَسْخٌ، لَيْسَ بِطَلَاقٍ، ذَكَرَ اللَّهُ الطَّلَاقَ فِي أَوَّلِ الْآيَةِ وَفِي آخِرِهَا، وَالْخُلْعَ بَيْنَ ذَلِكَ فَلَيْسَ بِطَلَاقٍ {الطَّلَاقُ مَرَّتَانِ فَإِمْسَاكٌ بِمَعْرُوفٍ أَوْ تَسْرِيحٌ بِإِحْسَانٍ}
english_text: Abū Bakr narrated to us, saying: Ibn ‘Uyaynah narrated to us, from ‘Amr, from Ṭāwūs, from Ibn ‘Abbās, who said: “It is only separation and annulment, not divorce. Allah mentioned divorce at the beginning of the verse and at its end, and Khul‘ in between, so it is not divorce {Divorce is twice. Then, either keep [her] in an acceptable manner or release [her] with good treatment} [Al-Baqarah: 229].”
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← ابْنُ عُيَيْنَةَ ← عَمْرٍو ← طَاوُسٍ ← ابْنِ عَبَّاسٍ
narrators_en: Abū Bakr → Ibn ‘Uyaynah → ‘Amr → Ṭāwūs → Ibn ‘Abbās

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: نا عَبْدَةُ بْنُ سُلَيْمَانَ، عَنْ سَعِيدِ بْنِ أَبِي عَرُوبَةَ، عَنْ قَتَادَةَ، عَنْ سَعِيدِ بْنِ الْمُسَيِّبِ، وَعَنْ أَبِي مَعْشَرٍ، عَنْ إِبْرَاهِيمَ، قَالَا: عِدَّةُ الْمُخْتَلِعَةِ، عِدَّةُ الْمُطَلَّقَةِ
english_text: Abū Bakr narrated to us, saying: ‘Abdah ibn Sulaymān narrated to us, from Sa‘īd ibn Abī ‘Arūbah, from Qatādah, from Sa‘īd ibn al-Musayyib; and from Abū Ma‘shar, from Ibrāhīm, who both said: “The waiting period of a woman who performs Khul‘ is the same as the waiting period of a divorced woman.”
narrators_ar:
أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← عَبْدَةُ بْنُ سُلَيْمَانَ ← سَعِيدِ بْنِ أَبِي عَرُوبَةَ ← قَتَادَةَ ← سَعِيدِ بْنِ الْمُسَيِّبِ
أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← عَبْدَةُ بْنُ سُلَيْمَانَ ← أَبِي مَعْشَرٍ ← إِبْرَاهِيمَ
narrators_en:
Abū Bakr → ‘Abdah ibn Sulaymān → Sa‘īd ibn Abī ‘Arūbah → Qatādah → Sa‘īd ibn al-Musayyib
Abū Bakr → ‘Abdah ibn Sulaymān → Abū Ma‘shar → Ibrāhīm

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: نا أَبُو مُعَاوِيَةَ، عَنْ هِشَامِ بْنِ عُرْوَةَ قَالَ: كَانَ أَبِي يَقُولُ: تَعْتَدُّ ثَلَاثَ حِيَضٍ، وَهُوَ أَوْلَى بِخِطْبَتِهَا فِي الْعِدَّةِ
english_text: Abū Bakr narrated to us, saying: Abū Mu‘āwiyah narrated to us, from Hishām ibn ‘Urwah, who said: My father used to say: “She waits for three menstrual cycles, and he is more entitled to propose to her during the waiting period.”
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← أَبُو مُعَاوِيَةَ ← هِشَامِ بْنِ عُرْوَةَ ← أَبِي
narrators_en: Abū Bakr → Abū Mu‘āwiyah → Hishām ibn ‘Urwah → His father

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: نا جَرِيرٌ، وَهُشَيْمٌ، عَنْ مُغِيرَةَ، عَنْ إِبْرَاهِيمَ قَالَ: كُلُّ فُرْقَةٍ كَانَتْ بَيْنَ الرَّجُلِ وَالْمَرْأَةِ، فَعِدَّتُهَا عِدَّةُ الْمُطَلَّقَةِ
english_text: Abū Bakr narrated to us, saying: Jarīr and Hushaym narrated to us, from Mughīrah, from Ibrāhīm, who said: “Every separation that occurs between a man and a woman, her waiting period is the waiting period of a divorced woman.”
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← جَرِيرٌ وَهُشَيْمٌ ← مُغِيرَةَ ← إِبْرَاهِيمَ
narrators_en: Abū Bakr → Jarīr and Hushaym → Mughīrah → Ibrāhīm

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: نا هُشَيْمٌ، عَنْ يُونُسَ، عَنِ الْحَسَنِ، أَنَّهُ كَانَ يَقُولُهُ
english_text: Abū Bakr narrated to us, saying: Hushaym narrated to us, from Yūnus, from Al-Ḥasan, that he used to say it.
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← هُشَيْمٌ ← يُونُسَ ← الْحَسَنِ
narrators_en: Abū Bakr → Hushaym → Yūnus → Al-Ḥasan

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: نا وَكِيعٌ، وَهِشَامٌ، عَنْ مَالِكِ بْنِ مِغْوَلٍ، عَنِ الشَّعْبِيِّ قَالَ: عِدَّتُهَا ثَلَاثَةُ قُرُوءٍ
english_text: Abū Bakr narrated to us, saying: Wakī‘ and Hishām narrated to us, from Mālik ibn Mighwal, from Al-Sha‘bī, who said: “Her waiting period is three menstrual periods (Qurū’).”
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← وَكِيعٌ وَهِشَامٌ ← مَالِكِ بْنِ مِغْوَلٍ ← الشَّعْبِيِّ
narrators_en: Abū Bakr → Wakī‘ and Hishām → Mālik ibn Mighwal → Al-Sha‘bī

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: نا وَكِيعٌ، عَنْ إِسْرَائِيلَ، عَنْ عَبْدِ الْأَعْلَى، عَنِ ابْنِ الْحَنَفِيَّةِ، عَنْ عَلِيٍّ قَالَ: عِدَّةُ الْمُخْتَلِعَةِ، عِدَّةُ الْمُطَلَّقَةِ
english_text: Abū Bakr narrated to us, saying: Wakī‘ narrated to us, from Isrā’īl, from ‘Abd al-A‘lā, from Ibn al-Ḥanafiyyah, from ‘Alī, who said: “The waiting period of a woman who performs Khul‘ is the same as the waiting period of a divorced woman.”
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← وَكِيعٌ ← إِسْرَائِيلَ ← عَبْدِ الْأَعْلَى ← ابْنِ الْحَنَفِيَّةِ ← عَلِيٍّ
narrators_en: Abū Bakr → Wakī‘ → Isrā’īl → ‘Abd al-A‘lā → Ibn al-Ḥanafiyyah → ‘Alī

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: نا ابْنُ مَهْدِيٍّ، عَنْ هِشَامٍ، عَنْ قَتَادَةَ، عَنْ سَعِيدٍ، وَأَبِي عِيَاضٍ، وَخِلَاسٍ قَالُوا: عِدَّةُ الْمُخْتَلِعَةِ، عِدَّةُ الْمُطَلَّقَةِ
english_text: Abū Bakr narrated to us, saying: Ibn Mahdī narrated to us, from Hishām, from Qatādah, from Sa‘īd, Abū ‘Iyāḍ, and Khilās, who said: “The waiting period of a woman who performs Khul‘ is the same as the waiting period of a divorced woman.”
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← ابْنُ مَهْدِيٍّ ← هِشَامٍ ← قَتَادَةَ ← سَعِيدٍ وَأَبِي عِيَاضٍ وَخِلَاسٍ
narrators_en: Abū Bakr → Ibn Mahdī → Hishām → Qatādah → Sa‘īd, Abū ‘Iyāḍ, and Khilās

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: نا شَبَابَةُ، عَنْ مَالِكِ بْنِ أَنَسٍ، عَنِ الزُّهْرِيِّ، عَنْ سَعِيدِ بْنِ الْمُسَيِّبِ، وَسُلَيْمَانَ بْنِ يَسَارٍ، وَغَيْرِهِمَا أَنَّهُمْ كَانُوا يَقُولُونَ: عِدَّةُ الْمُخْتَلِعَةِ، عِدَّةُ الْمُطَلَّقَةِ ثَلَاثَةُ قُرُوءٍ
english_text: Abū Bakr narrated to us, saying: Shabābah narrated to us, from Mālik ibn Anas, from Al-Zuhrī, from Sa‘īd ibn al-Musayyib, Sulaymān ibn Yasār, and others, that they used to say: “The waiting period of a woman who performs Khul‘ is the same as the waiting period of a divorced woman, three menstrual periods.”
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← شَبَابَةُ ← مَالِكِ بْنِ أَنَسٍ ← الزُّهْرِيِّ ← سَعِيدِ بْنِ الْمُسَيِّبِ وَسُلَيْمَانَ بْنِ يَسَارٍ
narrators_en: Abū Bakr → Shabābah → Mālik ibn Anas → Al-Zuhrī → Sa‘īd ibn al-Musayyib and Sulaymān ibn Yasār

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: نا هُشَيْمٌ، عَنْ حَجَّاجٍ، عَنْ نَافِعٍ، عَنِ ابْنِ عُمَرَ، عَنْ عُثْمَانَ أَنَّهُ قَالَ: عِدَّةُ الْمُخْتَلِعَةِ حَيْضَةٌ
english_text: Abū Bakr narrated to us, saying: Hushaym narrated to us, from Ḥajjāj, from Nāfi‘, from Ibn ‘Umar, from ‘Uthmān, that he said: “The waiting period of a woman who performs Khul‘ is one menstrual period.”
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← هُشَيْمٌ ← حَجَّاجٍ ← نَافِعٍ ← ابْنِ عُمَرَ ← عُثْمَانَ
narrators_en: Abū Bakr → Hushaym → Ḥajjāj → Nāfi‘ → Ibn ‘Umar → ‘Uthmān

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: نا عَبْدَةُ، عَنْ عُبَيْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ عُمَرَ، عَنْ نَافِعٍ، عَنِ ابْنِ عُمَرَ قَالَ: عِدَّةُ الْمُخْتَلِعَةِ حَيْضَةٌ
english_text: Abū Bakr narrated to us, saying: ‘Abdah narrated to us, from ‘Ubayd Allāh ibn ‘Umar, from Nāfi‘, from Ibn ‘Umar, who said: “The waiting period of a woman who performs Khul‘ is one menstrual period.”
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← عَبْدَةُ ← عُبَيْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ عُمَرَ ← نَافِعٍ ← ابْنِ عُمَرَ
narrators_en: Abū Bakr → ‘Abdah → ‘Ubayd Allāh ibn ‘Umar → Nāfi‘ → Ibn ‘Umar

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: نا يَحْيَى بْنُ سَعِيدٍ، عَنْ عُبَيْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ عُمَرَ، عَنْ نَافِعٍ، عَنِ ابْنِ عُمَرَ، أَنَّ الرُّبَيِّعَ اخْتَلَعَتْ مِنْ زَوْجِهَا، فَأَتَى عَمُّهَا عُثْمَانَ، فَقَالَ: تَعْتَدُّ بِحَيْضَةٍ وَكَانَ ابْنُ عُمَرَ يَقُولُ: تَعْتَدُّ ثَلَاثَ حِيَضٍ حَتَّى قَالَ هَذَا عُثْمَانُ، فَكَانَ يُفْتِي بِهِ وَيَقُولُ: خَيْرُنَا وَأَعْلَمُنَا
english_text: Abū Bakr narrated to us, saying: Yaḥyā ibn Sa‘īd narrated to us, from ‘Ubayd Allāh ibn ‘Umar, from Nāfi‘, from Ibn ‘Umar, that Al-Rubayyi‘ performed Khul‘ from her husband. Her uncle came to ‘Uthmān, who said: “She waits for one menstrual period.” Ibn ‘Umar used to say: “She waits for three menstrual periods,” until ‘Uthmān said this. He then gave Fatwas according to it, saying: “He is better than us and more knowledgeable than us.”
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← يَحْيَى بْنُ سَعِيدٍ ← عُبَيْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ عُمَرَ ← نَافِعٍ ← ابْنِ عُمَرَ
narrators_en: Abū Bakr → Yaḥyā ibn Sa‘īd → ‘Ubayd Allāh ibn ‘Umar → Nāfi‘ → Ibn ‘Umar

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: نا مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ سَوَاءٍ، عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي عَرُوبَةَ، عَنْ أَبِي الطُّفَيْلِ، عَنْ سَعِيدِ بْنِ حَمَلٍ، عَنْ عِكْرِمَةَ قَالَ: عِدَّةُ الْمُخْتَلِعَةِ حَيْضَةٌ قَضَاهَا رَسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ فِي جَمِيلَةَ بِنْتِ السَّلُولِ
english_text: Abū Bakr narrated to us, saying: Muḥammad ibn Sawā’ narrated to us, from Ibn Abī ‘Arūbah, from Abū al-Ṭufayl, from Sa‘īd ibn Ḥamal, from ‘Ikrimah, who said: “The waiting period of a woman who performs Khul‘ is one menstrual period, as decreed by the Messenger of Allah ﷺ regarding Jamīlah bint al-Salūl.”
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ سَوَاءٍ ← ابْنِ أَبِي عَرُوبَةَ ← أَبِي الطُّفَيْلِ ← سَعِيدِ بْنِ حَمَلٍ ← عِكْرِمَةَ
narrators_en: Abū Bakr → Muḥammad ibn Sawā’ → Ibn Abī ‘Arūbah → Abū al-Ṭufayl → Sa‘īd ibn Ḥamal → ‘Ikrimah

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: نا عَبْدُ الرَّحْمَنِ بْنُ مُحَمَّدٍ الْمُحَارِبِيُّ، عَنْ لَيْثٍ، عَنْ طَاوُسٍ، عَنِ ابْنِ عَبَّاسٍ قَالَ: عِدَّتُهَا حَيْضَةٌ
english_text: Abū Bakr narrated to us, saying: ‘Abd al-Raḥmān ibn Muḥammad al-Muḥāribī narrated to us, from Layth, from Ṭāwūs, from Ibn ‘Abbās, who said: “Her waiting period is one menstrual period.”
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← عَبْدُ الرَّحْمَنِ بْنُ مُحَمَّدٍ الْمُحَارِبِيُّ ← لَيْثٍ ← طَاوُسٍ ← ابْنِ عَبَّاسٍ
narrators_en: Abū Bakr → ‘Abd al-Raḥmān ibn Muḥammad al-Muḥāribī → Layth → Ṭāwūs → Ibn ‘Abbās

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: نا وَكِيعٌ، عَنْ سُفْيَانَ، عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عَبْدِ الرَّحْمَنِ، مَوْلَى آلِ طَلْحَةَ، عَنْ سُلَيْمَانَ بْنِ يَسَارٍ، أَنَّ الرُّبَيِّعَ اخْتَلَعَتْ فَأُمِرَتْ بِحَيْضَةٍ
english_text: Abū Bakr narrated to us, saying: Wakī‘ narrated to us, from Sufyān, from Muḥammad ibn ‘Abd al-Raḥmān, freed slave of Āl Ṭalḥah, from Sulaymān ibn Yasār, that Al-Rubayyi‘ performed Khul‘ and was ordered to wait one menstrual period.
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← وَكِيعٌ ← سُفْيَانَ ← مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عَبْدِ الرَّحْمَنِ مَوْلَى آلِ طَلْحَةَ ← سُلَيْمَانَ بْنِ يَسَارٍ
narrators_en: Abū Bakr → Wakī‘ → Sufyān → Muḥammad ibn ‘Abd al-Raḥmān, freed slave of Āl Ṭalḥah → Sulaymān ibn Yasār

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: نا أَبُو بَكْرِ بْنُ عَيَّاشٍ، عَنْ مُطَرِّفٍ، عَنِ الشَّعْبِيِّ قَالَ: الْمُعْتَدَّةُ تَعْتَدُّ فِي بَيْتِ زَوْجِهَا لِأَنَّهُ إِنْ شَاءَ رَاجَعَهَا
english_text: Abū Bakr narrated to us, saying: Abū Bakr ibn ‘Ayyāsh narrated to us, from Muṭarrif, from Al-Sha‘bī, who said: “The woman in waiting period waits in her husband’s house because if he wishes, he can take her back.”
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← أَبُو بَكْرِ بْنُ عَيَّاشٍ ← مُطَرِّفٍ ← الشَّعْبِيِّ
narrators_en: Abū Bakr → Abū Bakr ibn ‘Ayyāsh → Muṭarrif → Al-Sha‘bī

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: نا الثَّقَفِيُّ، عَنْ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ، عَنْ نَافِعٍ، عَنِ ابْنِ عُمَرَ، أَنَّ الرُّبَيِّعَ اخْتَلَعَتْ مِنْ زَوْجِهَا فَأَتَى مُعَوِّذٌ عُثْمَانَ فَسَأَلَهُ؟ فَقَالَ: تَنْتَقِلُ؟ قَالَ: نَعَمْ، تَنْتَقِلُ
english_text: Abū Bakr narrated to us, saying: Al-Thaqafī narrated to us, from ‘Abd Allāh, from Nāfi‘, from Ibn ‘Umar, that Al-Rubayyi‘ performed Khul‘ from her husband. Mu‘awwidh came to ‘Uthmān and asked him. He said: “Should she move?” He said: “Yes, she moves.”
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← الثَّقَفِيُّ ← عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ← نَافِعٍ ← ابْنِ عُمَرَ
narrators_en: Abū Bakr → Al-Thaqafī → ‘Abd Allāh → Nāfi‘ → Ibn ‘Umar

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: نا وَكِيعٌ، عَنْ شُعْبَةَ، عَنِ الْحَكَمِ، عَنْ خَيْثَمَةَ قَالَ: أُتِيَ بَشِيرُ بْنُ مَرْوَانَ فِي خُلْعٍ كَانَ بَيْنَ رَجُلٍ وَامْرَأَةٍ، فَلَمْ يُجِزْهُ، فَقَالَ لَهُ عَبْدُ اللَّهِ بْنُ شِهَابٍ الْخَوْلَانِيُّ: شَهِدْتُ عُمَرَ بْنَ الْخَطَّابِ أُتِيَ فِي خُلْعٍ كَانَ بَيْنَ رَجُلٍ وَامْرَأَتِهِ فَأَجَازَهُ
english_text: Abū Bakr narrated to us, saying: Wakī‘ narrated to us, from Shu‘bah, from Al-Ḥakam, from Khaythamah, who said: Bashīr ibn Marwān was brought a case of Khul‘ between a man and a woman, but he did not approve it. ‘Abd Allāh ibn Shihāb al-Khawlānī said to him: I witnessed ‘Umar ibn al-Khaṭṭāb being brought a case of Khul‘ between a man and his wife, and he approved it.
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← وَكِيعٌ ← شُعْبَةَ ← الْحَكَمِ ← خَيْثَمَةَ
narrators_en: Abū Bakr → Wakī‘ → Shu‘bah → Al-Ḥakam → Khaythamah

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: نا وَكِيعٌ، عَنْ شُعْبَةَ، عَنِ الْحَكَمِ، عَنِ الشَّعْبِيِّ، أَنَّ شُرَيْحًا، أَجَازَ خُلْعًا دُونَ السُّلْطَانِ
english_text: Abū Bakr narrated to us, saying: Wakī‘ narrated to us, from Shu‘bah, from Al-Ḥakam, from Al-Sha‘bī, that Shurayḥ approved a Khul‘ without (referring to) the ruler.
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← وَكِيعٌ ← شُعْبَةَ ← الْحَكَمِ ← الشَّعْبِيِّ
narrators_en: Abū Bakr → Wakī‘ → Shu‘bah → Al-Ḥakam → Al-Sha‘bī

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: نا ابْنُ عُلَيَّةَ، عَنْ أَيُّوبَ، عَنْ نَافِعٍ، عَنِ الرُّبَيِّعِ بِنْتِ مُعَوِّذِ ابْنِ عَفْرَاءَ، أَنَّ عَمَّهَا خَلَعَهَا مِنْ زَوْجِهَا، وَكَانَ يَشْرَبُ الْخَمْرَ دُونَ عُثْمَانَ، فَأَجَازَ ذَلِكَ عُثْمَانُ
english_text: Abū Bakr narrated to us, saying: Ibn ‘Ulayyah narrated to us, from Ayyūb, from Nāfi‘, from Al-Rubayyi‘ bint Mu‘awwidh ibn ‘Afrā’, that her uncle performed Khul‘ for her from her husband—who used to drink wine—without (consulting) ‘Uthmān, and ‘Uthmān approved that.
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← ابْنُ عُلَيَّةَ ← أَيُّوبَ ← نَافِعٍ ← الرُّبَيِّعِ بِنْتِ مُعَوِّذِ ابْنِ عَفْرَاءَ
narrators_en: Abū Bakr → Ibn ‘Ulayyah → Ayyūb → Nāfi‘ → Al-Rubayyi‘ bint Mu‘awwidh ibn ‘Afrā’

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: نا ابْنُ إِدْرِيسَ، عَنْ هِشَامٍ، عَنِ ابْنِ سِيرِينَ قَالَ: الْخُلْعُ جَائِزٌ دُونُ السُّلْطَانِ
english_text: Abū Bakr narrated to us, saying: Ibn Idrīs narrated to us, from Hishām, from Ibn Sīrīn, who said: “Khul‘ is valid without the ruler.”
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← ابْنُ إِدْرِيسَ ← هِشَامٍ ← ابْنِ سِيرِينَ
narrators_en: Abū Bakr → Ibn Idrīs → Hishām → Ibn Sīrīn

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: نا عَبْدُ الْأَعْلَى، عَنْ مَعْمَرٍ، عَنِ الزُّهْرِيِّ، أَنَّهُ قَالَ: الْخُلْعُ جَائِزٌ دُونَ السُّلْطَانِ
english_text: Abū Bakr narrated to us, saying: ‘Abd al-A‘lā narrated to us, from Ma‘mar, from Al-Zuhrī, that he said: “Khul‘ is valid without the ruler.”
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← عَبْدُ الْأَعْلَى ← مَعْمَرٍ ← الزُّهْرِيِّ
narrators_en: Abū Bakr → ‘Abd al-A‘lā → Ma‘mar → Al-Zuhrī

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: نا الثَّقَفِيُّ، عَنْ يَحْيَى بْنِ سَعِيدٍ، سَمِعَهُ يَقُولُ: كَانُوا يَخْتَلِعُونَ عِنْدَنَا دُونَ السُّلْطَانِ، فَإِذَا رُفِعَ إِلَى السُّلْطَانِ أَجَازَهُ
english_text: Abū Bakr narrated to us, saying: Al-Thaqafī narrated to us, from Yaḥyā ibn Sa‘īd, whom he heard saying: “They used to perform Khul‘ among us without the ruler, and if it was raised to the ruler, he approved it.”
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← الثَّقَفِيُّ ← يَحْيَى بْنِ سَعِيدٍ
narrators_en: Abū Bakr → Al-Thaqafī → Yaḥyā ibn Sa‘īd

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: نا عَبْدُ الْأَعْلَى، عَنْ يُونُسَ، عَنِ الْحَسَنِ قَالَ: هُوَ عِنْدَ السُّلْطَانِ
english_text: Abū Bakr narrated to us, saying: ‘Abd al-A‘lā narrated to us, from Yūnus, from Al-Ḥasan, who said: “It is with the ruler.”
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← عَبْدُ الْأَعْلَى ← يُونُسَ ← الْحَسَنِ
narrators_en: Abū Bakr → ‘Abd al-A‘lā → Yūnus → Al-Ḥasan

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: نا عَبْدُ الْوَهَّابِ الثَّقَفِيُّ، عَنْ أَيُّوبَ، عَنْ سَعِيدِ بْنِ الْمُسَيِّبِ، فِي الْمُخْتَلِعَةِ قَالَ: إِنْ كَانَتْ نَاشِزَةً أَمَرَهُ السُّلْطَانُ أَنْ يَخْلَعَ
english_text: Abū Bakr narrated to us, saying: ‘Abd al-Wahhāb al-Thaqafī narrated to us, from Ayyūb, from Sa‘īd ibn al-Musayyib, regarding the woman who performs Khul‘. He said: “If she is disobedient, the ruler orders him to perform Khul‘.”
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← عَبْدُ الْوَهَّابِ الثَّقَفِيُّ ← أَيُّوبَ ← سَعِيدِ بْنِ الْمُسَيِّبِ
narrators_en: Abū Bakr → ‘Abd al-Wahhāb al-Thaqafī → Ayyūb → Sa‘īd ibn al-Musayyib

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: نا وَكِيعُ بْنُ الْجَرَّاحِ، عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ الْمُبَارَكِ، عَنْ يَحْيَى بْنِ أَبِي كَثِيرٍ، قَالَ: كَانَ عِمْرَانُ بْنُ حُصَيْنٍ، وَابْنُ مَسْعُودٍ يَقُولَانِ فِي الَّتِي تَفْتَدِي مِنْ زَوْجِهَا لَهَا طَلَاقٌ مَا كَانَتْ فِي عِدَّتِهَا
english_text: Abū Bakr narrated to us, saying: Wakī‘ ibn al-Jarrāḥ narrated to us, from ‘Alī ibn al-Mubārak, from Yaḥyā ibn Abī Kathīr, who said: ‘Imrān ibn Ḥuṣayn and Ibn Mas‘ūd used to say regarding the woman who redeems herself from her husband: “Divorce applies to her as long as she is in her waiting period.”
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← وَكِيعُ بْنُ الْجَرَّاحِ ← عَلِيِّ بْنِ الْمُبَارَكِ ← يَحْيَى بْنِ أَبِي كَثِيرٍ
narrators_en: Abū Bakr → Wakī‘ ibn al-Jarrāḥ → ‘Alī ibn al-Mubārak → Yaḥyā ibn Abī Kathīr

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: نا وَكِيعٌ، عَنْ أَبِي فَضَالَةَ، عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ أَبِي طَالِبٍ، وَعَنِ ابْنِ عَوْنٍ، عَنِ الْأَعْوَرِ، عَنْ أَبِي الدَّرْدَاءِ قَالَا: لِلْمُخْتَلِعَةِ طَلَاقٌ مَا دَامَتْ فِي الْعِدَّةِ
english_text: Abū Bakr narrated to us, saying: Wakī‘ narrated to us, from Abū Faḍālah, from ‘Alī ibn Abī Ṭālib, and from Ibn ‘Awn, from Al-A‘war, from Abū al-Dardā’, who both said: “Divorce applies to the woman who performs Khul‘ as long as she is in the waiting period.”
narrators_ar:
أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← وَكِيعٌ ← أَبِي فَضَالَةَ ← عَلِيِّ بْنِ أَبِي طَالِبٍ
أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← وَكِيعٌ ← ابْنِ عَوْنٍ ← الْأَعْوَرِ ← أَبِي الدَّرْدَاءِ
narrators_en:
Abū Bakr → Wakī‘ → Abū Faḍālah → ‘Alī ibn Abī Ṭālib
Abū Bakr → Wakī‘ → Ibn ‘Awn → Al-A‘war → Abū al-Dardā’

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: نا عَبْدُ اللَّهِ بْنُ مُبَارَكٍ، عَنِ الْحَسَنِ بْنِ يَحْيَى، عَنِ الضَّحَّاكِ، قَالَ: اخْتَلَفَ ابْنُ مَسْعُودٍ، وَابْنُ عَبَّاسٍ فِي الرَّجُلِ يَخْلَعُ امْرَأَتَهُ، ثُمَّ يُطَلِّقُهَا، قَالَ أَحَدُهُمَا: "لَيْسَ طَلَاقُهُ بِشَيْءٍ، وَقَالَ الْآخَرُ: مَا دَامَتْ فِي الْعِدَّةِ فَإِنَّ الطَّلَاقَ يَلْحَقُهَا
english_text: Abū Bakr narrated to us, saying: ‘Abd Allāh ibn Mubārak narrated to us, from Al-Ḥasan ibn Yaḥyā, from Al-Ḍaḥḥāk, who said: Ibn Mas‘ūd and Ibn ‘Abbās differed regarding a man who performs Khul‘ with his wife then divorces her. One of them said: “His divorce is nothing.” The other said: “As long as she is in the waiting period, divorce applies to her.”
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← عَبْدُ اللَّهِ بْنُ مُبَارَكٍ ← الْحَسَنِ بْنِ يَحْيَى ← الضَّحَّاكِ
narrators_en: Abū Bakr → ‘Abd Allāh ibn Mubārak → Al-Ḥasan ibn Yaḥyā → Al-Ḍaḥḥāk

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: نا ابْنُ مُبَارَكٍ، عَنْ مَعْمَرٍ، عَنْ قَتَادَةَ، عَنْ سَعِيدٍ قَالَ: يَلْحَقُهَا الطَّلَاقُ
english_text: Abū Bakr narrated to us, saying: Ibn Mubārak narrated to us, from Ma‘mar, from Qatādah, from Sa‘īd, who said: “Divorce applies to her.”
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← ابْنُ مُبَارَكٍ ← مَعْمَرٍ ← قَتَادَةَ ← سَعِيدٍ
narrators_en: Abū Bakr → Ibn Mubārak → Ma‘mar → Qatādah → Sa‘īd

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: نا وَكِيعٌ، عَنْ هِشَامٍ، عَنْ قَتَادَةَ، عَنْ سَعِيدِ بْنِ الْمُسَيِّبِ قَالَ: يَجْرِي عَلَيْهَا الطَّلَاقُ مَا كَانَتْ فِي الْعِدَّةِ
english_text: Abū Bakr narrated to us, saying: Wakī‘ narrated to us, from Hishām, from Qatādah, from Sa‘īd ibn al-Musayyib, who said: “Divorce applies to her as long as she is in the waiting period.”
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← وَكِيعٌ ← هِشَامٍ ← قَتَادَةَ ← سَعِيدِ بْنِ الْمُسَيِّبِ
narrators_en: Abū Bakr → Wakī‘ → Hishām → Qatādah → Sa‘īd ibn al-Musayyib

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: نا جَرِيرٌ، عَنْ مُغِيرَةَ، عَنْ إِبْرَاهِيمَ، فِي الرَّجُلِ يَخْلَعُ امْرَأَتَهُ ثُمَّ يُطَلِّقُهَا قَالَ: أَخْذُهُ الْمَالَ تَطْلِيقَةٌ، وَكَلَامُهُ بِالطَّلَاقِ تَطْلِيقَةٌ
english_text: Abū Bakr narrated to us, saying: Jarīr narrated to us, from Mughīrah, from Ibrāhīm, regarding a man who performs Khul‘ with his wife then divorces her. He said: “His taking the money is one divorce, and his pronouncing divorce is (another) divorce.”
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← جَرِيرٌ ← مُغِيرَةَ ← إِبْرَاهِيمَ
narrators_en: Abū Bakr → Jarīr → Mughīrah → Ibrāhīm

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: نا عَبْدُ الْأَعْلَى بْنُ عَبْدِ الْأَعْلَى، عَنْ سَعِيدٍ، عَنْ قَتَادَةَ، عَنْ سَعِيدِ بْنِ الْمُسَيِّبِ، وَخِلَاسٍ قَالَا: يَلْحَقُهَا الطَّلَاقُ مَا كَانَتْ فِي الْعِدَّةِ
english_text: Abū Bakr narrated to us, saying: ‘Abd al-A‘lā ibn ‘Abd al-A‘lā narrated to us, from Sa‘īd, from Qatādah, from Sa‘īd ibn al-Musayyib and Khilās, who both said: “Divorce applies to her as long as she is in the waiting period.”
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← عَبْدُ الْأَعْلَى بْنُ عَبْدِ الْأَعْلَى ← سَعِيدٍ ← قَتَادَةَ ← سَعِيدِ بْنِ الْمُسَيِّبِ وَخِلَاسٍ
narrators_en: Abū Bakr → ‘Abd al-A‘lā ibn ‘Abd al-A‘lā → Sa‘īd → Qatādah → Sa‘īd ibn al-Musayyib and Khilās

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: نا عَبْدُ الْأَعْلَى، عَنْ مَعْمَرٍ، عَنِ الزُّهْرِيِّ قَالَ: الْخُلْعُ تَطْلِيقَةٌ بَائِنٌ، وَمَا أَتْبَعَ مِنَ الطَّلَاقِ فَإِنَّهُ يَلْحَقُهَا مَا كَانَتْ فِي الْعِدَّةِ
english_text: Abū Bakr narrated to us, saying: ‘Abd al-A‘lā narrated to us, from Ma‘mar, from Al-Zuhrī, who said: “Khul‘ is one irrevocable divorce, and whatever divorce follows it applies to her as long as she is in the waiting period.”
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← عَبْدُ الْأَعْلَى ← مَعْمَرٍ ← الزُّهْرِيِّ
narrators_en: Abū Bakr → ‘Abd al-A‘lā → Ma‘mar → Al-Zuhrī

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: نا وَكِيعٌ، عَنْ إِسْرَائِيلَ، عَنْ جَابِرٍ، عَنِ الشَّعْبِيِّ، عَنْ مَسْرُوقٍ، فِي الرَّجُلِ يَخْلَعُ امْرَأَتَهُ ثُمَّ يُطَلِّقُهَا قَالَ: ذَلِكَ أَبْعَدُ لَهُ مِنْهَا
english_text: Abū Bakr narrated to us, saying: Wakī‘ narrated to us, from Isrā’īl, from Jābir, from Al-Sha‘bī, from Masrūq, regarding a man who performs Khul‘ with his wife then divorces her. He said: “That makes him further from her.”
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← وَكِيعٌ ← إِسْرَائِيلَ ← جَابِرٍ ← الشَّعْبِيِّ ← مَسْرُوقٍ
narrators_en: Abū Bakr → Wakī‘ → Isrā’īl → Jābir → Al-Sha‘bī → Masrūq

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: نا حَفْصُ بْنُ غِيَاثٍ، عَنْ إِسْمَاعِيلَ، عَنِ الشَّعْبِيِّ، عَنْ شُرَيْحٍ قَالَ: يَلْزَمُ الْمُطَلَّقَةَ الطَّلَاقُ فِي الْعِدَّةِ
english_text: Abū Bakr narrated to us, saying: Ḥafṣ ibn Ghiyāth narrated to us, from Ismā‘īl, from Al-Sha‘bī, from Shurayḥ, who said: “Divorce applies to the divorced woman in the waiting period.”
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← حَفْصُ بْنُ غِيَاثٍ ← إِسْمَاعِيلَ ← الشَّعْبِيِّ ← شُرَيْحٍ
narrators_en: Abū Bakr → Ḥafṣ ibn Ghiyāth → Ismā‘īl → Al-Sha‘bī → Shurayḥ

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: نا أَبُو أُسَامَةَ، عَنْ سُفْيَانَ، عَنْ مَنْصُورٍ، وَمُغِيرَةَ، عَنْ إِبْرَاهِيمَ، وَعَنْ بَيَانٍ، عَنِ الشَّعْبِيِّ، فِي الْمَرْأَةِ تُبَارِئُ زَوْجَهَا فَيُطَلِّقُهَا، قَالَا: يَقَعُ عَلَيْهَا مَا كَانَتْ فِي عِدَّتِهَا قَالَ سُفْيَانُ: نَرَى أَنَّهُ يَقَعُ
english_text: Abū Bakr narrated to us, saying: Abū Usāmah narrated to us, from Sufyān, from Manṣūr and Mughīrah, from Ibrāhīm; and from Bayān, from Al-Sha‘bī, regarding a woman who mutually separates (Mubāra’ah) from her husband and he divorces her. They both said: “It applies to her as long as she is in her waiting period.” Sufyān said: “We consider that it applies.”
narrators_ar:
أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← أَبُو أُسَامَةَ ← سُفْيَانَ ← مَنْصُورٍ وَمُغِيرَةَ ← إِبْرَاهِيمَ
أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← أَبُو أُسَامَةَ ← سُفْيَانَ ← بَيَانٍ ← الشَّعْبِيِّ
narrators_en:
Abū Bakr → Abū Usāmah → Sufyān → Manṣūr and Mughīrah → Ibrāhīm
Abū Bakr → Abū Usāmah → Sufyān → Bayān → Al-Sha‘bī

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: نا عِيسَى بْنُ يُونُسَ، عَنِ الْأَوْزَاعِيِّ، عَنْ عَطَاءٍ، فِي الْمُخْتَلِعَةِ قَالَ: يَلْحَقُهَا الطَّلَاقُ
english_text: Abū Bakr narrated to us, saying: ‘Īsā ibn Yūnus narrated to us, from Al-Awzā‘ī, from ‘Aṭā’, regarding the woman who performs Khul‘. He said: “Divorce applies to her.”
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← عِيسَى بْنُ يُونُسَ ← الْأَوْزَاعِيِّ ← عَطَاءٍ
narrators_en: Abū Bakr → ‘Īsā ibn Yūnus → Al-Awzā‘ī → ‘Aṭā’

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: نا ابْنُ الْمُبَارَكِ، عَنِ ابْنِ جُرَيْجٍ، عَنْ عَطَاءٍ، عَنِ ابْنِ عَبَّاسٍ، وَابْنِ الزُّبَيْرِ، أَنَّهُمَا قَالَا: لَيْسَ بِشَيْءٍ
english_text: Abū Bakr narrated to us, saying: Ibn al-Mubārak narrated to us, from Ibn Jurayj, from ‘Aṭā’, from Ibn ‘Abbās and Ibn al-Zubayr, who both said: “It is nothing.”
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← ابْنُ الْمُبَارَكِ ← ابْنِ جُرَيْجٍ ← عَطَاءٍ ← ابْنِ عَبَّاسٍ وَابْنِ الزُّبَيْرِ
narrators_en: Abū Bakr → Ibn al-Mubārak → Ibn Jurayj → ‘Aṭā’ → Ibn ‘Abbās and Ibn al-Zubayr

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: نا هُشَيْمٌ، عَنْ مَنْصُورٍ، عَنْ عَمْرِو بْنِ هَرِمٍ، عَنْ جَابِرِ بْنِ زَيْدٍ، أَنَّهُ كَانَ يَقُولُ: لَا يَلْحَقُهَا طَلَاقُهُ إِيَّاهَا مَا كَانَتْ فِي عِدَّةٍ مِنْهُ بَائِنَةً
english_text: Abū Bakr narrated to us, saying: Hushaym narrated to us, from Manṣūr, from ‘Amr ibn Harim, from Jābir ibn Zayd, that he used to say: “His divorce of her does not apply to her as long as she is in an irrevocable waiting period from him.”
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← هُشَيْمٌ ← مَنْصُورٍ ← عَمْرِو بْنِ هَرِمٍ ← جَابِرِ بْنِ زَيْدٍ
narrators_en: Abū Bakr → Hushaym → Manṣūr → ‘Amr ibn Harim → Jābir ibn Zayd

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: نا هُشَيْمٌ، عَنْ يُونُسَ، وَمَنْصُورٍ، عَنِ الْحَسَنِ، وَحَجَّاجٍ، عَنْ عَطَاءٍ، فِي الْمُخْتَلِعَةِ: لَا يَقَعُ عَلَيْهَا طَلَاقُ زَوْجِهَا مَا كَانَتْ فِي عِدَّةِ مِنْهُ بَائِنَةً
english_text: Abū Bakr narrated to us, saying: Hushaym narrated to us, from Yūnus and Manṣūr, from Al-Ḥasan; and Ḥajjāj from ‘Aṭā’, regarding the woman who performs Khul‘: “Her husband's divorce does not apply to her as long as she is in an irrevocable waiting period from him.”
narrators_ar:
أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← هُشَيْمٌ ← يُونُسَ وَمَنْصُورٍ ← الْحَسَنِ
أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← هُشَيْمٌ ← حَجَّاجٍ ← عَطَاءٍ
narrators_en:
Abū Bakr → Hushaym → Yūnus and Manṣūr → Al-Ḥasan
Abū Bakr → Hushaym → Ḥajjāj → ‘Aṭā’

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: نا وَكِيعٌ، عَنْ حَسَنٍ، عَنْ لَيْثٍ، عَنْ طَاوُسٍ قَالَ: لَا يَقَعُ عَلَيْهَا الطَّلَاقُ مَا كَانَتْ فِي الْعِدَّةِ
english_text: Abū Bakr narrated to us, saying: Wakī‘ narrated to us, from Ḥasan, from Layth, from Ṭāwūs, who said: “Divorce does not apply to her as long as she is in the waiting period.”
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← وَكِيعٌ ← حَسَنٍ ← لَيْثٍ ← طَاوُسٍ
narrators_en: Abū Bakr → Wakī‘ → Ḥasan → Layth → Ṭāwūs
